title: Audio Visual Install & Service Engineer

hours.details: Willingness to work flexible hours, including weekends and evenings, as required for emergency callouts.

description: The Audio Visual Engineer at 21st Century AV will provide on and off-site technical support to our clients, ensuring the optimal performance of audio visual systems. This role involves responding to emergency callouts, conducting scheduled maintenance visits, and managing various administrative tasks, including accurate logging and reporting. Additionally the candidate will be responsible for surveys, installs, commissioning and basic level of audio programming. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
responsibilities: Respond promptly to emergency service requests, providing on-site troubleshooting and repairs for audio visual systems.
Ensure technical calls are managed within a 2-hour response time and arrive on-site within 24 hours.
Maintain clear communication with clients and the service team regarding status and resolution of issues.
Conduct regular Planned Maintenance Visits (PMV), logging details including serial numbers in the CRM, and capturing drawings/pictures for reference.
Identify potential issues during maintenance visits and recommend proactive solutions; provide feedback to the Service Contract Manager after each visit.
Provide expert technical support for AV equipment, focusing on Yealink and Logitech systems; escalate and resolve complex issues with the internal support team.

Document all service activities and client interactions in accordance with company procedures; build and maintain positive client relationships; provide technical guidance on system operation and maintenance; ensure site visit reports are accurate and sent the same day.
requirements: Proven experience as an audio visual engineer (not just service) with installation, configuration, and maintenance, including Yealink and Logitech systems.
Relevant technical certifications (e.g., CTS, Crestron, Extron, AMX) are highly desirable.
Electrical or electronics engineering qualification (HNC/HND or equivalent) is advantageous.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to explain technical issues to non-technical clients; strong organizational and documentation skills.
Strong problem-solving ability; able to work under pressure and handle multiple tasks.
Willingness to work flexible hours, including weekends and evenings; valid UK driving license and willingness to travel across the UK for on-site visits.
benefits: Competitive salary
Company vehicle and mobile phone.
Pension, Medical & EAP programs
Ongoing training and professional development opportunities.
Supportive team environment with career progression prospects.

Our dedication to exceptional customer service has established us as a trusted partner in the AV industry. We are currently seeking a skilled Audio Visual Engineer to join our dynamic team, responsible for managing service contract emergency callouts, planned maintenance visits, surveys, commissioning and installations.

raw_text:
[IMAGE: image](https://21stcenturyav.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Black-Logo-21st.jpg.webp) [link](https://21stcenturyav.com/) [link](https://21stcenturyav.com/) 
# Audio Visual Install & Service Engineer
 
UK Location:
 
£32,000 – £45,000K Dependant on Experience Salary:
 
Full-Time, Permanent Contract Type:
 
Services Contract Co-ordinator/Project Manager Reporting To:
 
[IMAGE: image](https://21stcenturyav.com/wp-content/uploads/elementor/thumbs/Digtial-Sianage-Installation-rby2zk19383q5jwt0htszqnp1uhmocon9mxmaoeoio.jpg)
 
## Company Overview
 
21st Century AV is a leading provider of cutting-edge audio visual solutions, delivering state-of-the-art technology and comprehensive support services to clients across t he UK. Our dedication to exceptional customer service has established us as a trusted partner in the AV industry. We are currently seeking a skilled Audio Visual Engineer to join our dynamic team, responsible for managing service contract emergency callouts , planned maintenance visits , surveys, commissioning and installations
 
## Role Overview
 
The Audio Visual Engineer at 21st Century AV will provide on and off-site technical support to our clients, ensuring the optimal performance of audio visual systems. This role involves responding to emergency callouts, conducting scheduled maintenance visits, and managing various administrative tasks, including accurate logging and reporting. Additionally the candidate will be responsible for surveys, installs, commissioning and basic level of audio programming. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
 
## Key Responsibilities
 
#### Emergency Callouts
 
  • Respond promptly to emergency service requests, providing on-site troubleshooting and repairs for audio visual systems.
  • Ensure technical calls are managed within a 2-hour response time and arrive on-site within 24 hours.
  • Maintain clear communication with clients and the service team regarding the status and resolution of issues.
 

#### Planned Maintenance Visits (PMV)
 
  • Conduct regular maintenance visits as per the service contract schedule.
  • Accurately log details of each visit, including serial numbers of equipment serviced, using the company’s CRM system.
  • Take and maintain drawings/pictures relevant to each service contract for reference and documentation.
  • Identify potential issues during maintenance visits and recommend proactive solutions.
  • Provide feedback to the Service Contract Manager after each visit to ensure continuity and customer satisfaction.
 

#### Technical Support & Troubleshooting
 
  • Provide expert technical support for a range of audio visual equipment, with a particular focus on Yealink and Logitech systems, ensuring that skills are kept up to date.
  • Maintain a log of supplier and manufacturer support contacts to facilitate on-site resolutions.
  • Collaborate with the internal support team to escalate and resolve complex technical issues.
  • Document all service activities, including repairs, maintenance, and client interactions, in accordance with company procedures.
 

#### Client Relationship Management
 
  • Build and maintain positive relationships with clients, ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction.
  • Provide clients with technical advice and guidance on system operation and maintenance.
  • Work proactively to elevate the service contract experience for customers.
  • Ensure an accurate and detailed site visit report is produced on the same day and sent to the team
 

#### Site Surveys & Commissioning
 
  • Conduct full install and technical site surveys
  • Independent installation and team installation for 21st Century AV
  • Final day commissioning or training on installation works.
 

#### Vehicle & Equipment Management
 
  • Ensure the upkeep, cleanliness, and audit compliance of the company vehicle.
  • Maintain demo stock and ensure all equipment is ready and available for client demonstrations when required.
  • Adhere to the company’s PPE and dress code standards for all site visits.
 

#### Ad Hoc Responsibilities
 
  • Provide internal AV support for the office as needed.
  • Continuously manage your own training and professional development to stay current with industry trends and technologies.
 
## Required Skills & Experience
 
#### Technical Expertise:
 
  • Proven experience as an audio visual engineer (not just service)
  • Strong understanding of audio visual systems, including installation, configuration, and maintenance, particularly with Yealink and Logitech systems.
  • Proficiency in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues with AV equipment.
 

#### Certifications & Qualifications:
 
  • Relevant technical certifications (e.g., CTS, Crestron, Extron, AMX) are highly desirable.
  • Electrical or electronics engineering qualification (HNC/HND or equivalent) is advantageous.
 

#### Communication & Organisational Skills:
 
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to explain technical issues to non-technical clients.
  • Strong organisational skills to manage schedules, logs, and client interactions effectively.
  • Strong written skills for documenting service activities and reporting.
 

#### Problem-Solving Ability:
 
  • Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Proactive approach to identifying and solving technical issues.
 

### Flexibility & Availability:
 
  • Willingness to work flexible hours, including weekends and evenings, as required for emergency callouts.
  • Valid UK driving license and willingness to travel across the UK for on-site visits.
 

## Benefits:
 
  • Competitive salary
  • Company vehicle and mobile phone.
  • Pension, Medical & EAP programs
  • Ongoing training and professional development opportunities.
  • Supportive team environment with career progression prospects.
 

## Application Process:
 
To apply, please send your CV and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this role to . Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. [alison@21stcenturyav.com](mailto:alison@21stcenturyav.com)
 

## Equal Opportunity Employer:
 
21st Century AV is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
 
This job specification is a guideline and not an exhaustive list of responsibilities and qualifications. The role may require additional duties as necessary.
 
## Clients We Work With

title: Bilingual Pricing Analyst
description:
Collaborate with innovative 3Mers around the world

At 3M, we apply science in collaborative ways to improve lives daily. With $24 billion in sales, our 90,000 employees connect with customers all around the world. Department Overview the Pricing Operations Team is part of Global Operations. The Pricing Operations Team provides administration and support for special prices to Marketing, Sales, and Customer Service personnel.

The impact you will make in this role

As a Pricing Analyst, you will play a key role in ensuring the accurate compilation, organization, and reconciliation of pricing data between multiple systems utilized by 3M GSC and 3M subsidiaries. In this role, you will maintain and enhance pricing applications, coordinate updates, manage requests, and support business groups within Customer Operations. You will also create price reports and perform ad-hoc analysis to support business decisions.

You will make an impact by:

  • Create and maintain Deviated and Standard Prices in our systems based on the process governance and playbooks
  • Compile, Organize, and Reconcile Data between multiple systems using Excel, SAP, Sales Force and SharePoint.
  • Demonstrate Strong Attention to Detail to ensure accuracy on data reports and processes.
  • Document and maintain clear procedures and flowcharts.
  • Demonstrate problem solving, reasoning, and analytical skills, make suggestions for problem solutions or enhancements.
  • Provide accurate and timely status of work progress.
  • Maintaining ongoing communications with Pricing, Customer Service, and business stakeholders via email, Sales Force cases, etc.
  • Reject request outside USAC governance policy

Job Description:
 
Ihr Beitrag zu unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg
 
Als / Industriemechaniker (m/w/*) für den Bereich Dia- und CBN-Schleifwerkzeuge am Standort Niederstetten haben Sie die Möglichkeit Ihr Wissen zielgerichtet einzusetzen, um unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg voranzubringen. Dabei umfasst Ihr Aufgabengebiet: Zerspanungsmechaniker
 
  • Programmieren nach detaillierten Teilezeichnungen, Einrichten und Bedienen von NC – Drehmaschinen mit Siemenssteuerung
  • Allgemeine Bearbeitung von verschiedenen Werkstücken
  • Maß- und Qualitätskontrolle
  • Genaue der gefertigten Teile
  • Regelmäßige Wartung, Pflege und Instandhaltung der Maschine nach den werksinternen Reinigungs- und Wartungsplänen, sowie Inspektion des gesamten Arbeitsbereichs am Ende der Schicht.
  • Überwachung der Maschinenfunktionen
  • Befolgung aller Sicherheitsregeln des Unternehmens

Die dieser Rolle umfassen: Mindestqualifikationen
 
  • Abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Dreher, oder Berufserfahrung als NC-Dreher
  • Mechanische Erfahrung, technisches Verständnis und gute mathematische Kenntnisse
  • Fähigkeit technische Zeichnungen zu lesen und ein gutes Auge für Details zu haben
  • Ergebnisorientierte Vorgehensweise
  • Bereitschaft zu Wechselschichtbetrieb
 
Diese weiteren Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil:
 
  • Erfahrung auf Boehringer DUS 400TI und Boehringer DUS 630TI NC-Drehmaschinen mit Siemenssteuerung, sowie Gildemeister NEF 320 NC-Drehmaschine mit Heidenhain-Steuerung wären von Vorteil.

Der Abschluss der Transaktion wird für das erste Halbjahr 2026 erwartet, vorbehaltlich der Erfüllung der Informations- und gegenüber den zuständigen Betriebsräten sowie regulatorischer und weiterer Anforderungen. Konsultationspflichten Es wird erwartet, dass diese Position nach Abschluss der Transaktion möglicherweise auf Nimbus übergeht.

title: CIP Sr SIBG Analyst
description: Job Description: Goal of the position: As a CIP Senior Analyst, you will manage complex incentive activities and serve as a key point of contact for the business. You will build and maintain MDF and rebate agreements, validate rebates, clear GL reconciliations, prepare and execute accrual meetings, and lead testing for system enhancements. You will also manage MDF PoP and payment issues and drive process change, partnering closely with divisions and BG CC. The role includes main challenges such as building and governing MDF and rebate agreements across multiple stakeholders; validating rebates and ensuring accuracy of accruals and payouts; clearing GL reconciliations and remediating root causes; preparing and executing accrual meetings; acting as POC with Business/BG CC for incentive-related matters; driving process changes and testing system enhancements to improve performance. Main activities include: Agreements: Build and maintain MDF and rebate agreements; ensure terms, rates, eligibility, and timelines are accurate and compliant. Rebate validation: Confirm eligibility, volumes, rates, and calculations; resolve exceptions. GL recon clearance: Analyze and clear open items; coordinate with Finance; document corrective actions. Accrual meetings: Prepare data and materials; execute meetings; track decisions and follow-ups. POC with Business/BG CC: Serve as primary contact; triage and resolve complex inquiries. Process improvement: Update job aids and SOPs; perform UAT/PIT testing for enhancements. MDF PoP & payment issues: Manage complex PoP reviews; resolve payment discrepancies; escalate as needed. Rebate payment issues: Lead case resolution; coordinate cross-functionally. Reporting: Create custom reports from existing sources; monitor SLAs and accurate metrics. Exception reports: Own and take corrective action on high-priority exceptions. The impact you will make in this role includes improving payout accuracy, GL health, and accrual quality; driving completion of tasks within defined SLAs and quality standards; implementing process improvements and maintaining robust documentation; serving as a trusted contact for divisions and BG CC on CIP matters.

[[IMAGE: image](/Search/assets/logo)](https://www.3m.com/careers)

## CIP Sr SIBG Analyst
 
[Apply](https://3m.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Search/job/PH-Taguig/CIP-Sr-SIBG-Analyst_R01159956/apply)
 
On-site
 
PH, Taguig
 
Full time
 
Posted 6 Days Ago
 
R01159956
 
3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas.  Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter. Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn @3M. Safety is a core value at 3M. All employees are expected to contribute to a strong Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) culture by following safety policies, identifying hazards, and engaging in continuous improvement. Job Description:
 

## Goal of the position:
 

### As a CIP Senior Analyst, you will manage complex incentive activities and serve as a key point of contact for the business. You will build and maintain MDF and rebate agreements, validate rebates, clear GL reconciliations, prepare and execute accrual meetings, and lead testing for system enhancements. You will also manage MDF PoP and payment issues and drive process change, partnering closely with divisions and BG CC.
 
Main challenges
 
  • Build, maintain, and govern MDF and rebate agreements across multiple stakeholders.
  • Validate rebates and ensure accuracy of accruals and payouts.
  • Clear GL reconciliations and remediate root causes.
  • Prepare and execute accrual meetings and actions.
  • Act as POC with Business/BG CC for incentive-related matters.
  • Drive process changes and test system enhancements to improve performance.
 
Main activities
 
  • Agreements: Build and maintain MDF and rebate agreements; ensure terms, rates, eligibility, and timelines are accurate and compliant.
  • Rebate validation: Confirm eligibility, volumes, rates, and calculations; resolve exceptions.
  • GL recon clearance: Analyze and clear open items; coordinate with Finance; document corrective actions.
  • Accrual meetings: Prepare data and materials; execute meetings; track decisions and follow-ups.
  • POC with Business/BG CC: Serve as primary contact; triage and resolve complex inquiries.
  • Process improvement: Update job aids and SOPs; perform UAT/PIT testing for enhancements.
  • MDF PoP & payment issues: Manage complex PoP reviews; resolve payment discrepancies; escalate as needed.
  • Rebate payment issues: Lead case resolution; coordinate cross-functionally. • Reporting: Create custom reports from existing sources; monitor SLAs and accurate metrics.
  • Exception reports: Own and take corrective action on high-priority exceptions.
 
The impact you will make in this role
 
  • You will improve payout accuracy, GL health, and accrual quality.
  • You will drive completion of tasks within defined SLAs and quality standards.
  • You will implement process improvements and maintain robust documentation.
  • You will serve as a trusted contact for divisions and BG CC on CIP matters.
 
Qualifications
 
Your Skills and Expertise
 
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:
 
  • A graduate degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.
  • At least 2 years of experience related to incentives, rebates/MDF, finance operations, or similar.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral. • Highly customer service and quality-oriented mindset.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel.
 
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
 
  • Experience building and maintaining incentive agreements and leading accrual meetings.
  • Familiarity with ERP/CIP tools (e.g., SAP/Vistex) and CRM (e.g., Salesforce).
  • Knowledge of Power BI, Excel macros/VBA, or basic coding.

title: Bilingual Pricing Analyst
description:
Job Description:

Collaborate with innovative 3Mers around the world

At 3M, we apply science in collaborative ways to improve lives daily. With $24 billion in sales, our 90,000 employees connect with customers all around the world. Department Overview the Pricing Operations Team is part of Global Operations. The Pricing Operations Team provides administration and support for special prices to Marketing, Sales, and Customer Service personnel.

The impact you will make in this role

As a Pricing Analyst, you will play a key role in ensuring the accurate compilation, organization, and reconciliation of pricing data between multiple systems utilized by 3M GSC and 3M subsidiaries. In this role, you will maintain and enhance pricing applications, coordinate updates, manage requests, and support business groups within Customer Operations. You will also create price reports and perform ad-hoc analysis to support business decisions.

You will make an impact by:

  • Create and maintain Deviated and Standard Prices in our systems based on the process governance and playbooks
  • Compile, Organize, and Reconcile Data between multiple systems using Excel, SAP, Sales Force and SharePoint.
  • Demonstrate Strong Attention to Detail to ensure accuracy on data reports and processes.
  • Document and maintain clear procedures and flowcharts.
  • Demonstrate problem solving, reasoning, and analytical skills, make suggestions for problem solutions or enhancements.
  • Provide accurate and timely status of work progress.
  • Maintaining ongoing communications with Pricing, Customer Service, and business stakeholders via email, Sales Force cases, etc.
  • Reject request outside USAC governance policy

Your Skills and Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:

: Bachelor´s degree concluded and/or ongoing. Academic

  • English and Spanish intermediate/advance level. Verbal and written Bilingual:
  • Minimum one year of working experience in operational areas as pricing, customer service, collections and similar. Experience:
  • Knowledge or experience working with Salesforce, SAP, Excel (Pivot tables; Vlookup; Conditional formulas; Macros, etc)

Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:

  • ### Problem solving
  • ### Effective communication
  • ### Generate and record improvement ideas

Phillipines Work location:

This role has on-site work model, with the employee working at least four days a week in the corporate office Philippines . No relocation supported.

Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Chat with Max

For assistance with searching through our current job openings or for more information about all things 3M, visit Max, our virtual recruiting assistant on 3M.com/careers.

title: Channel Sales Representative for Collision Repair, Monterrey, Mexico

hours.details: Remote, based in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon with frequent travel; Full-time role.

description: Collaborate with innovative 3Mers around the world\n\nAs you will play a key role in . In this role you will be able Channel Sales Representative for Collision Repair, driving sales growth, profitability, and market share through effective channel management and distributor engagement to develop strong relationships with key partners in the automotive aftermarket sector, ensuring the implementation of 3M’s commercial strategies, and supporting distribution networks in delivering value through innovative 3M solutions for collision repair.
responsibilities: You will develop and manage relationships with distributors, wholesalers and paint companies within the collision repair ecosystem.
You will provide training to distributors and implement 3M commercial programs to achieve sales and profitability targets.
You will drive demand generation through the effective use of Marketing Development Funds to support the adoption of 3M solutions and increase loyalty in body shops and paint jobbers.
You will monitor distributor performance, inventory levels, and sell-out data to ensure effective channel execution.
You will gather voice-of-customer insights and conduct market analysis to identify new business opportunities and channel development areas

You will coordinate with end user sales team, activation marketing, portfolio leaders, application engineering, customer service, credit & collections and supply chain teams to deliver high-quality customer service and operational excellence.
You will ensure compliance with 3M’s policies, pricing structures, and ethical business standards.
requirements: Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Marketing, Engineering, or related field.
Minimum 3 years of experience in channel sales, distribution management, or B2B sales in the automotive aftermarket or industrial sector.
Intermediate to advanced English required.
Knowledge of automotive refinish or collision repair processes preferred
Proficiency in Customer Relationship Management tools and Microsoft Office Suite.
Strong communication, negotiation, and analytical abilities; goal-oriented and customer-focused mindset; ability to work independently and cross-functionally.
Willingness to travel within assigned territory. Valid driver’s license.

Safety is a core value at 3M. Job Description:
 
Collaborate with innovative 3Mers around the world
 
As you will play a key role in . In this role you will be able Channel Sales Representative for Collision Repair, driving sales growth, profitability, and market share through effective channel management and distributor engagement to develop strong relationships with key partners in the automotive aftermarket sector, ensuring the implementation of 3M’s commercial strategies, and supporting distribution networks in delivering value through innovative 3M solutions for collision repair.
 
The impact you will make in this role
 
  • You will develop and manage relationships with distributors, wholesalers and paint companies within the collision repair ecosystem.
  • You will provide training to distributors and implement 3M commercial programs to achieve sales and profitability targets.
  • You will drive demand generation through the effective use of Marketing Development Funds to support the adoption of 3M solutions and increase loyalty in body shops and paint jobbers.
  • You will monitor distributor performance, inventory levels, and sell-out data to ensure effective channel execution.
  • You will gather voice-of-customer insights and conduct market analysis to identify new business opportunities and channel development areas
  • You will coordinate with end user sales team, activation marketing, portfolio leaders, application engineering, customer service, credit & collections and supply chain teams to deliver high-quality customer service and operational excellence.
  • You will ensure compliance with 3M’s policies, pricing structures, and ethical business standards.
 
Your Skills and Expertise
 
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:
 
  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Marketing, Engineering, or related field.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in channel sales, distribution management, or B2B sales in the automotive aftermarket or industrial sector.
  • Intermediate to advanced English required.
 
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
 
  • Knowledge of automotive refinish or collision repair processes preferred
  • Proficiency in Customer Relationship Management tools and Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Strong communication, negotiation, and analytical abilities; goal-oriented and customer-focused mindset; ability to work independently and cross-functionally.
  • Willingness to travel within assigned territory. Valid driver’s license.
 
Work Location: This position is remote, based in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon with frequent travel required across key territories within Mexico to visit distributors, key accounts, and end-users. The role may include periodic in-person meetings or training sessions aligned with 3M’s business needs and remote work policies.
 
Relocation: Not authorized

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

title: Specialist Operational Excellence (m/w/*)
description:
Job Description: Ihr Beitrag zu unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg

Als am Standort Hilden haben Sie die Möglichkeit Ihr Wissen zielgerichtet einzusetzen, um unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg voranzubringen. Dabei umfasst Ihr Aufgabengebiet: Specialist Operational Excellence (m/w/*)

  • Entwicklung und Implementierung von Produktionssystemen zur Optimierung der Fertigungsprozesse.
  • Analyse bestehender Produktionsabläufe und Identifizierung von
  • Einführung von zur Steigerung der Effizienz und Reduzierung von Verschwendung.
  • Zusammenarbeit mit interdisziplinären Teams zur Umsetzung von Best Practices in der Fertigung mit europäischen und globalen
  • Überwachung und Visualisierung der und Erstellung von Berichten zur Leistungsmessung.

Das sind Ihre Kompetenzen

Die dieser Rolle umfassen: Mindestqualifikationen

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Ingenieurwesen, Produktionstechnik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation.
  • Fundierte Berufserfahrung in der oder einem ähnlichen Bereich.
  • Tiefgreifende Kenntnisse in der Implementierung und Entwicklung von Produktionssystemen sowie in Lean-Management und kontinuierlicher Verbesserung.
  • Erfahrung im Coaching von Teams und Führungskräfte im Rahmen der Entwicklung von Produktionssystemen.
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.

Diese weiteren Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil:

  • Erfahrung im Automotive-Bereich sowie Kenntnisse der IATF 16949.
  • Gute Kenntnisse in SAP oder ähnlichen ERP-Systemen, sowie der Digitalisierung von Reports mit z.B. PowerBi
  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Standardisierung von Prozessen.
  • Gute Kenntnisse von Continuous und Projektmanagement.
  • Kenntnisse in der Prozessdatenanalyse.

Stellenbezogene Informationen

  • Hilden, vor Ort.
  • Reiseanteil: Gelegentliche internationale Dienstreisen möglich.

title: Senior Product Development Engineer (m/f/*)
description:
Safety is a core value at 3M. All employees are expected to contribute to a strong Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) culture by following safety policies, identifying hazards, and engaging in continuous improvement. At 3M, we believe diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race/ethnicity, nationality, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, matters, age or disability, or any other relevant characteristic protected under applicable local law. Job Description:

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
As a Senior Product Development Engineer (m/f/*) Displays and Electronics Product Platform Auto Lab, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. at

Here, you will make an impact by:

  • Developing state of the art optical films for automotive application such as glazing and displays.
  • Designing laboratory experiments and simulations to prove or discard working hypotheses, perform root cause analysis, support problem solving process, evaluate performance vs. customer requirements or product optimization.
  • Using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools to evaluate experimental, simulation or field results and data, producing deep, accurate and reliable fact-based reports and presentations. Communicating those results and analysis to relevant stakeholders.
  • Establishing and cultivating an extensive network of support within the company and through continuous interactions with outside organizations and partners.
  • Frequently interacting with customers to better understand customer requirements, processes and applications.
  • Contributing to technology scouting and product roadmaps.
  • Supporting and leading cross-functional teams, collaborating with R&D, sales, marketing, and production teams to provide technical guidance and support, ensuring projects are delivered on time, within budget, and with the highest quality.
responsibilities: Developing state of the art optical films for automotive application such as glazing and displays.

Designing laboratory experiments and simulations to prove or discard working hypotheses, perform root cause analysis, support problem solving process, evaluate performance vs. customer requirements or product optimization.

Using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools to evaluate experimental, simulation or field results and data, producing deep, accurate and reliable fact-based reports and presentations. Communicating those results and analysis to relevant stakeholders.
Establishing and cultivating an extensive network of support within the company and through continuous interactions with outside organizations and partners.
Frequently interacting with customers to better understand customer requirements, processes and applications.
Contributing to technology scouting and product roadmaps.

Supporting and leading cross-functional teams, collaborating with R&D, sales, marketing, and production teams to provide technical guidance and support, ensuring projects are delivered on time, within budget, and with the highest quality.
requirements: Master's degree in relevant engineering, physics, optics or other scientific field from an accredited institution.
Substantial experience in optical systems, or automotive/aerospace glazing or displays, especially in product development or R&D.
Deep understanding of optical physics and experience with optical laboratory equipment, measurement and characterization and test methods development.
Good knowledge of Design of Experiments and strong data analysis capabilities, including but not limited to statistical software use.
Fluent in English and German.

## Senior Product Development Engineer (m/f/*)
 
[Apply](https://3m.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Search/job/DE-Neuss/Senior-Product-Development-Engineer--m-f---_R01159553-2/apply)
 
On-site
 
DE, Neuss
 
Full time
 
Posted 12 Days Ago
 
R01159553
 
Safety is a core value at 3M. All employees are expected to contribute to a strong Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) culture by following safety policies, identifying hazards, and engaging in continuous improvement. At 3M, we believe diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race/ethnicity, nationality, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, matters, age or disability, or any other relevant characteristic protected under applicable local law. Job Description:
 
The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
 
As a Senior Product Development Engineer (m/f/*) Displays and Electronics Product Platform Auto Lab, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. at
 
Here, you will make an impact by:
 
  • Developing state of the art optical films for automotive application such as glazing and displays.
  • Designing laboratory experiments and simulations to prove or discard working hypotheses, perform root cause analysis, support problem solving process, evaluate performance vs. customer requirements or product optimization.
  • Using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools to evaluate experimental, simulation or field results and data, producing deep, accurate and reliable fact-based reports and presentations. Communicating those results and analysis to relevant stakeholders.
  • Establishing and cultivating an extensive network of support within the company and through continuous interactions with outside organizations and partners.
  • Frequently interacting with customers to better understand customer requirements, processes and applications.
  • Contributing to technology scouting and product roadmaps.
  • Supporting and leading cross-functional teams, collaborating with R&D, sales, marketing, and production teams to provide technical guidance and support, ensuring projects are delivered on time, within budget, and with the highest quality.
 
Your Skills and Expertise
 
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who meet following minimum requirements:
 
  • Master's degree in relevant engineering, physics, optics or other scientific field from an accredited institution.
  • Substantial experience in optical systems, or automotive/aerospace glazing or displays, especially in product development or R&D.
  • Deep understanding of optical physics and experience with optical laboratory equipment, measurement and characterization and test methods development.
  • Good knowledge of Design of Experiments and strong data analysis capabilities, including but not limited to statistical software use.
  • Fluent in English and German.
 
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
 
  • PhD. degree in relevant engineering, physics, optics or other scientific field from an accredited institution.
  • Good photography and image quality understanding and processing skills.
  • Ability to write image processing related code in Phyton or other equivalent programming language would be highly helpful.
  • Deep understanding of automotive glazing quality and optical concepts, typical requirements, standards, metrics and measurement devices.
  • Knowledge of manufacturing processes relevant to automotive glazing or displays, such as lamination, glass processing, or coating technologies.
  • Strong communication, problem-solving, and skills with experience in cross-functional, global organizations.
 
Job specifics:
 
  • Location: Neuss, Germany.
  • Based on site.
  • Full time.
  • Travel: may include up to 15%

  • Diagnose stellen en structureel verbeteren van hoogtechnologische installaties.
  • Ondersteunen van projecten met de opstart van nieuwe of aangepaste processen op vlak van mechanica, hydraulica & pneumatica.
 
Je vaardigheden en expertise
 
  • Je hebt een bachelor in elektro-mechanica of onderhoudstechnieken
  • Een sterke kennis van draaiend equipment (pompen, uitlijnen, motoren, enz...)
  • Je kan zelfstandig en efficiënt werken maar ook in team kan je vlot functioneren.
  • Je hebt een analytische geest om fouten te detecteren en om gepaste correctieve acties te nemen tem de borging (aanpassen PO-plan, magazijn)
  • Je hebt een positieve ingesteldheid è constructieve samenwerking met collega’s en produktie.
  • Relevante ervaring is een pluspunt maar geen noodzaak.
  • Mogelijkheid in ploegen (V/L) werken als shiftman.
 
Ondersteuning van je welzijn
 
Een eerlijk, prestatiegericht en concurrerend salaris is fundamenteel voor 3M. Om aantrekkelijk te blijven voor de beste talenten, monitoren we regelmatig de standaarden in de markt. Daarnaast worden afhankelijk van functie en locatie diverse sociale voorzieningen aangeboden, waaronder bijvoorbeeld aanvullende salariscomponenten zoals vakantiegeld, een bedrijfspensioen en voorzieningen volgens CAO (indien van toepassing)- en andere overeenkomsten.
 pregnancy/maternity-related

description:
Job Description:

Ihr Beitrag zu unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg

Als am Standort Hilden haben Sie die Möglichkeit Ihr Wissen zielgerichtet einzusetzen, um unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg voranzubringen. Dabei umfasst Ihr Aufgabengebiet: (m/w/*)

  • Sie realisieren im Bereich der Prozessautomation.
  • Sie implementieren Inspektionssysteme und entwickeln sie weiter.
  • Sie verbinden und Vernetzen unsere Produktionsanlagen für die Realisierung von Industrie 4.0.
  • Sie betreiben aktives Projektmanagement und moderieren in der Umsetzung.
  • Sie arbeiten strategische und projektbezogen mit globalen Engineering- und IT-Partnern zusammen.

Das sind Ihre Kompetenzen

Die dieser Rolle umfassen: Mindestqualifikationen

  • Sie besitzen ein abgeschlossenes Ingenieurs-Studium der und Regelungstechnik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
  • Sie können Erfahrung im Bereich von Inspektionssystemen vorweisen.
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.

Diese weiteren Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil:

  • Praktische Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Datenbanksystemen, APIs und Kommunikation in der
  • Erste Kenntnisse in dem Bereich Six Sigma/Lean Management.
  • Sie besitzen gute Kenntnisse in MS-Office Anwendungen
  • Kenntnisse von Programmiersprachen, SPS Erfahrung mit OT Systemen.

Stellenbezogene Informationen

  • Hilden, vor Ort

title: Adv. Trademark Assistant
description:
Adv. Trademark Assistant

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

The Adv. Trademark Assistant will be part of the Global Legal Service Center (GLSC) and will support the Trademark Work Group, which assists 3M to obtain, maintain, and enforce 3M’s brands

The Adv. Trademark Assistant will report to the GLSC Trademark Work Group lead and work closely with the Global Trademark Team. The Advance Trademark Assistant is an experienced Intellectual Property professional with substantive knowledge of trademark frameworks across different geographies.

Responsibilities:
- Online Enforcement: Conduct regular reviews of URLs, websites, and e-commerce platforms that may infringe 3M trademarks.
- Execute manual searches for trademark misuses on various websites and search engines.
- Domain and Website Monitoring: Review and manage 3M owned domain names to prevent unauthorized use.
- Review and research evidence/documents to analyze the overall fact pattern of claim and synthesize data to establish a case
- Database Management: Utilize the trademark brand protection database for tagging and updating.
- Maintain a portfolio of domains and social media accounts.
- Manage and prioritize a large and varied case load effectively and efficiently.
- Copyright and Compliance: Review images and content for unauthorized use.
- Conduct status checks for compliance of enforcement matters and ensure adherence to brand guidelines.
- Renewal of 3M’s trademark assets globally: Work with the Global Trademark Team and 3M’s businesses to confirm mark is in use for the goods and services provided and renew the mark in various governmental offices around the world where the mark has been registered.
- Trademark Docketing: Track and manage the statuses of trademark applications and registrations, including tracking deadlines, filings, office action responses from governmental agencies to maintain 3M’s trademark rights.

Your Skills and Expertise
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:
- Possess a bachelor’s degree in law with high academic credentials from an accredited institution.
- Minimum of three (3) to five (5) years of trademark prosecution and/or watch notice experience
- IP Management System experience, preferably Anaqua and trademark brand protection databases such as Corsearch.
- Familiarity with e-commerce platforms and online brand monitoring tools.
- Strong analytical, communication, attention to details and project management skills.
- Ability to influence and collaborate with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders.
- Strong organizational skills; ability to establish priorities, balance multiple tasks and deadlines at one time and effectively manage competing priorities.

Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
- Certifications or additional qualifications in IP.
- Experience in working in teams.
- Experience handling confidential information.
- Experience in Multinational Corporations in a similar field of expertise.

Relocation Assistance
In country relocation assistance is not authorized for this role.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

title: Compliance Analyst
description:
Job Description: Compliance Analyst

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

Compliance Analyst –will be part of the Global Legal Service Center (GLSC) and will perform a variety of compliance program related under the supervision of GLSC Ethics and Compliance (E&C) leader in support of Global Ethics and Compliance position will report to the GLSC Multiple Pillar Work Group Lead and work closely with the GLSC E&C Lead and respective stakeholders. The Compliance Analyst is an experienced compliance professional with foundational knowledge of legal compliance practice and multi-regional stakeholder Department. This engagement.

Responsibilities:

Under the direction of GLSC E&C Lead, perform basic tasks related to compliance processes including:

  • Knowledge Repository Management
  • Integrity Assessment related tasks
  • Report Generation and Metrics Monitoring
  • Training support
  • System access related tasks
  • Various Inbox management
  • Other compliance program support services

Your Skills and Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:

  • Possess a bachelor’s degree in law with high academic credentials from an accredited institution.
  • Minimum of 4 years of experience in compliance process support preferably in similar MNCs, Law firms, or Global Capability Centers.
  • Excellent communication skills, ability to learn quickly and manage projects efficiently.
  • Ability to influence and collaborate with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in navigating/analyzing various systems and databases.
  • Strong organizational skills; ability to establish priorities, balance multiple tasks and deadlines at one time and effectively manage competing priorities.
  • Effective interpersonal skills and a collaborative team player

Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include

  • Any additional compliance course certification
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel
  • Familiarity with Gen AI tools

Relocation Assistance:

  • In country relocation assistance is not authorized for this role.
  • Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

title: CIR Analyst - CIR Credit & Collection (Japan)
description:
Job Description:

 Handles inquiries of moderate scope and complexity within customer service areas, such as Account Management, Customer Issue Resolution, Customer Inquiry Support, Customer Service Analytics.

 Manages simple to moderately complex orders from customers from order entry to order fulfillment. Handles customer inquiries and concerns which typically require identifying solutions by selecting from alternative courses of action. Serves as a first level escalation resource for routine and basic non-routine issues brought up by others whether internal stakeholders or external customers. Assists in analyzing customer service reports and handles simple and moderately complex special requests related to order resolution. Handles inquiries of simple and moderate complexity within customer service areas, such as Account Management, Customer Issue Resolution, Customer Inquiry Support, Customer Service Analytics.

 The position of CIR Analyst will be located at 3M Global Service Center, Philippines.

 Duties and responsibilities

  • (1) (2) (3) Data preparation for Dispute Report, Recon File Creation between 3M data and customer data for Dispute Management and Cash Application. Data preparation and checking for Credit Block Releasing Set-up output of Billing in SAP. Manage list of invoices.
  • Efficiently build credibility and trust with customers and businesses through timely and accurate Customer Service resolution processing.
  • Knowledge and use of Excel and Microsoft Office systems. Maintain and remain current with all training and certifications.
  • Interprets policies and regulations, investigates problems, and communicates with other departments and providers to research and resolve issues, identify and implement service solutions.
  • Actively participates in relevant corporate complies with professional and quality standards, complies with corporate policies and procedures, and acts in a manner consistent with 3M’s values and ethical standards. programs/initiatives,
  • May provide training to new employees and other members of work groups, including customer service, and related processes and topics. Participates in department process improvement teams.
  • An individual employed in this position is expected to broaden their knowledge of credit policies and principles and strengthen skills in analysis, reporting, negotiating and presenting. Strong interpersonal skills in working with diverse levels of business partners, team members and leadership are required to deliver on Customer Service Operations.
  • Driving a high level of service to deliver tasks according to agreed Service Level Agreements.
  • Complies with corporate policies and procedures, and acts in a manner consistent with 3M’s values and ethical standards.

 Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or higher from preferable business, economics but other degrees are accepted.
  • Minimum of 1 year of customer service, billing, credit and collection, finance, supply chain or sales experience.
  • Strong customer facing skills. Maintains a professional, positive, and tactful demeanor with clients and customers.
  • Knowledge of assigned area of responsibility and 3M structure, organization and business.
  • Demonstration of strong interpersonal, communication, analytical, organizational and short-term planning skills.
  • Develops and broadens negotiating and influencing skills.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Demonstrates the following competencies: adaptability, initiative, accountability, teamwork and continuous improvement mindset
  • Handles a variety of inquiries and develops solutions for moderately complex issues. Strongly deliver and follow Team KPI targets in timely and efficient manner
  • Problem solving requires the use of judgment, research and analytic skills to determine possible solutions and make appropriate choices.
  • Experience with customer service processes and systems – SAP, Excel, and Microsoft Office systems.
  • Disciplined, organized and resilient.

 Preferred Qualifications

  • Japanese Language proficiency: Write/Read High, Speak Mid-Level (JLPT N2 level).
  • Finance experience: AR, Dispute management.
  • MS Office: Excel for creating the summarized data to utilize Pivot table, VLOOKUP, and related formula.

 Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

 Please access the linked document by clicking select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application, you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

title: Automated Inspection Engineer

salary.raw: The expected compensation range for this position is $122,292 - $149,468, which includes base pay plus variable incentive pay, if eligible.

hours.details: Full-time on-site role; onsite work in Maplewood, MN.

closing_date.raw_text: Good Faith Posting Date Range 12/15/2025 To 01/14/2026 Or until filled

description: Automated Inspection Engineer. This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military experience to a 3M career. The Automated Inspection and Measurement group is responsible for fundamental technology development, application investigations, system integration and deployment, and long-term support across many 3M divisions in the areas of automated inspection, measurement, machine vision, automation, and process data systems. This group is a leader in digital technology within the corporation through its technology development and breadth of system deployment across 3M manufacturing operations. This job describes the impact you’ll make, including designing and developing automated inspection systems, implementing and supporting them in manufacturing environments, and pursuing technology development for custom applications. The Impact You’ll Make in this Role: Design and develop automated inspection systems using optics, image processing, and AI; Implement and support automated inspection systems in a manufacturing environment, including travel and on-call support; Develop technology for custom inspection and measurement applications with emphasis on opto-mechanical systems, machine vision, and automation; Analyze current inspection processes and develop plans to improve detection accuracy, stability, and actionable response; Work within a team to solve manufacturing challenges.
responsibilities: Design and develop automated inspection systems using expertise areas such as optics, image processing, and AI
Implement and support automated inspection systems in a manufacturing environment, including travel to manufacturing locations and on-call support of systems
Technology development for custom inspection and measurement applications with particular emphasis on opto-mechanical systems, machine vision, and automation
Analyze current inspection processes and develop plans to improve detection accuracy, stability, and actionable response
Working within a team setting to solve manufacturing challenges
requirements: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Physics, or science field (completed and verified prior to start)
Three (3) years of experience in an engineering, manufacturing, or production environment in a private, public, government or military environment
Possess expertise equivalent to that which would be obtained in a master’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or related field
Experience in process engineering within a manufacturing or industrial setting
Three (3) years of professional experience implementing automated inspection or machine vision systems
Experience with 3M custom machine vision platforms
Experience with Cognex machine vision platforms
Experience with Zebra machine vision platforms
Image processing, signal processing, optics, software, or electronics experience.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, excellent networking skills, exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills.

## Automated Inspection Engineer
 
[Apply](https://3m.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Search/job/US-Minnesota-Maplewood/Automated-Inspection-Engineer_R01159515/apply)
 
On-site
 
US, Minnesota, Maplewood
 
Full time
 
Posted 14 Days Ago
 
R01159515
 
Applicable to US Applicants Only:The expected compensation range for this position is $122,292 - $149,468, which includes base pay plus variable incentive pay, if eligible. This range represents a good faith estimate for this position. The specific compensation offered to a candidate may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s relevant knowledge, training, skills, work location, and/or experience. In addition, this position may be eligible for a range of benefits (e.g., Medical, Dental & Vision, Health Savings Accounts, Health Care & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts, Disability Benefits, Life Insurance, Voluntary Benefits, Paid Absences and Retirement Benefits, etc.). Additional information is available at: Good Faith Posting Date Range 12/15/2025 To 01/14/2026 Or until filled All US-based 3M full time employees will need to sign an employee agreement as a condition of employment with 3M. This agreement lays out key terms on using 3M Confidential Information and Trade Secrets. It also has provisions discussing conflicts of interest and how inventions are assigned. Employees that are Job Grade 7 or equivalent and above may also have obligations to not compete against 3M or solicit its employees or customers, both during their employment, and for a period after they leave 3M. Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn @3M. Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties. Safety is a core value at 3M. All employees are expected to contribute to a strong Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) culture by following safety policies, identifying hazards, and engaging in continuous improvement. Pay & Benefits Overview: 3M does not discriminate in hiring or employment on the basis of race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Job Description:
 
Automated Inspection Engineer
 
Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a wide variety of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with other curious, creative 3Mers. Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World
 
This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military experience to a 3M career.
 
The Automated Inspection and Measurement group is responsible for fundamental technology development, application investigations, system integration and deployment, and long-term support across many 3M divisions in the areas of automated inspection, measurement, machine vision, automation, and process data systems. This group is a leader in digital technology within the corporation through its technology development and breadth of system deployment across 3M manufacturing operations. The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
 
As an Automated Inspection Engineer, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:
 
  • Design and develop automated inspection systems using expertise areas such as optics, image processing, and AI
  • Implement and support automated inspection systems in a manufacturing environment, including travel to manufacturing locations and on-call support of systems
  • Technology development for custom inspection and measurement applications with particular emphasis on opto-mechanical systems, machine vision, and automation
  • Analyze current inspection processes and develop plans to improve detection accuracy, stability, and actionable response
  • Working within a team setting to solve manufacturing challenges
 
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications: Your Skills and Expertise
 
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Physics, or science field (completed and verified prior to start)
  • Three (3) years of experience in an engineering, manufacturing, or production environment in a private, public, government or military environment
 
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
 
  • Possess expertise equivalent to that which would be obtained in a master’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or related field
  • Experience in process engineering within a manufacturing or industrial setting
  • Three (3) years of professional experience implementing automated inspection or machine vision systems
  • Experience with 3M custom machine vision platforms
  • Experience with Cognex machine vision platforms
  • Experience with Zebra machine vision platforms
  • Image processing, signal processing, optics, software, or electronics experience.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, excellent networking skills, exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills.
 
Work location:
 
  • Onsite
  • Maplewood, MN
 
Travel: May include up to 25% US & international, primarily to 3M manufacturing locations
 
Relocation Assistance: May be authorized
 
Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).
 
Supporting Your Well-being
 
3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope. For assistance with searching through our current job openings or for more information about all things 3M, visit Max, our virtual recruiting assistant on Chat with Max 3M.com/careers.
 https://www.3m.com/3M/en_US/careers-us/working-at-3m/benefits/. https://www.3m.com/3M/en_US/careers-us/working-at-3m/benefits/

title: Prozessingenieur (m/w/*)
description: Job Description: Ihr Beitrag zu unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg Als am Standort Hilden haben Sie die Möglichkeit Ihr Wissen zielgerichtet einzusetzen, um unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg voranzubringen. Dabei umfasst Ihr Aufgabengebiet: Prozessingenieur (m/w/*) • Technische Verantwortung und eigenverantwortliche Betreuung eines Prozessbereiches zur Herstellung von Polymerfilmen, inkl. Analyse und Lösung von • Entwicklung und Erstellung von Qualitäts- und Produktionsstandards sowie deren nachhaltiger Implementierung. • Ermittlung von Daten und Kennzahlen zur Beurteilung der Produktionsprozesse und der Produktqualität. • Bearbeitung und Leitung von Projekten zur Optimierung und Weiterentwicklung der vorhandenen Produktionsprozesse, um höchste Produktqualität und Produktivität sicherzustellen. • Kostenreduktion durch effiziente Prozessgestaltung und -optimierung sowie Sicherstellung der Einhaltung von ATEX-Richtlinien und -Standards. Das sind Ihre Kompetenzen Die dieser Rolle umfassen: Mindestqualifikationen • Abgeschlossenes Master-Studium im Bereich Verfahrenstechnik, Maschinenbau oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation. • Fundierte Berufserfahrung in der chemischen Industrie sowie im Umgang mit ATEX-Richtlinien & Standards. • Ausgepräge Kenntnisse im Projektmanagement sowie der Prozessoptimierung. • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift. Diese weiteren Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil: • Erfahrung in der Kunststoffindustrie von Vorteil. • Verständnis von Lean Manufacturing und Six Sigma Methoden. • Kenntnisse in SAP, Datenanalytik und Statistik wünschenswert. Stellenbezogene Informationen • Hilden, hybrid pregnancy/maternity-related

title: Zerspanungsmechaniker als NC-Dreher (m/w/*)
description:
Job Description:

Ihr Beitrag zu unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg

Als / Industriemechaniker (m/w/*) für den Bereich Dia- und CBN-Schleifwerkzeuge am Standort Niederstetten haben Sie die Möglichkeit Ihr Wissen zielgerichtet einzusetzen, um unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg voranzubringen. Dabei umfasst Ihr Aufgabengebiet: Zerspanungsmechaniker

  • Programmieren nach detaillierten Teilezeichnungen, Einrichten und Bedienen von NC – Drehmaschinen mit Siemenssteuerung
  • Allgemeine Bearbeitung von verschiedenen Werkstücken
  • Maß- und Qualitätskontrolle
  • Genaue der gefertigten Teile
  • Regelmäßige Wartung, Pflege und Instandhaltung der Maschine nach den werksinternen Reinigungs- und Wartungsplänen, sowie Inspektion des gesamten Arbeitsbereichs am Ende der Schicht.
  • Überwachung der Maschinenfunktionen
  • Befolgung aller Sicherheitsregeln des Unternehmens

Das sind Ihre Kompetenzen

Die dieser Rolle umfassen: Mindestqualifikationen

  • Abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Dreher, oder Berufserfahrung als NC-Dreher
  • Mechanische Erfahrung, technisches Verständnis und gute mathematische Kenntnisse
  • Fähigkeit technische Zeichnungen zu lesen und ein gutes Auge für Details zu haben
  • Ergebnisorientierte Vorgehensweise
  • Bereitschaft zu Wechselschichtbetrieb

Diese weiteren Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil:

  • Erfahrung auf Boehringer DUS 400TI und Boehringer DUS 630TI NC-Drehmaschinen mit Siemenssteuerung, sowie Gildemeister NEF 320 NC-Drehmaschine mit Heidenhain-Steuerung wären von Vorteil.

3M hat Vereinbarungen zum Verkauf seines Geschäftsbereichs Precision Grinding & Finishing an Nimbus getroffen, eine in Europa ansässige mit Fokus auf die Weiterentwicklung mittelständischer Investmentgesellschaft Industrieunternehmen.

Der Abschluss der Transaktion wird für das erste Halbjahr 2026 erwartet, vorbehaltlich der Erfüllung der Informations- und gegenüber den zuständigen Betriebsräten sowie regulatorischer und weiterer Anforderungen. Konsultationspflichten Es wird erwartet, dass diese Position nach Abschluss der Transaktion möglicherweise auf Nimbus übergeht.

title: CIP Sr SIBG Analyst
description:
Goal of the position:

### As a CIP Senior Analyst, you will manage complex incentive activities and serve as a key point of contact for the business. You will build and maintain MDF and rebate agreements, validate rebates, clear GL reconciliations, prepare and execute accrual meetings, and lead testing for system enhancements. You will also manage MDF PoP and payment issues and drive process change, partnering closely with divisions and BG CC.

Main challenges

  • Build, maintain, and govern MDF and rebate agreements across multiple stakeholders.
  • Validate rebates and ensure accuracy of accruals and payouts.
  • Clear GL reconciliations and remediate root causes.
  • Prepare and execute accrual meetings and actions.
  • Act as POC with Business/BG CC for incentive-related matters.
  • Drive process changes and test system enhancements to improve performance.

Main activities

  • Agreements: Build and maintain MDF and rebate agreements; ensure terms, rates, eligibility, and timelines are accurate and compliant.
  • Rebate validation: Confirm eligibility, volumes, rates, and calculations; resolve exceptions.
  • GL recon clearance: Analyze and clear open items; coordinate with Finance; document corrective actions.
  • Accrual meetings: Prepare data and materials; execute meetings; track decisions and follow-ups.
  • POC with Business/BG CC: Serve as primary contact; triage and resolve complex inquiries.
  • Process improvement: Update job aids and SOPs; perform UAT/PIT testing for enhancements.
  • MDF PoP & payment issues: Manage complex PoP reviews; resolve payment discrepancies; escalate as needed.
  • Rebate payment issues: Lead case resolution; coordinate cross-functionally. • Reporting: Create custom reports from existing sources; monitor SLAs and accurate metrics.
  • Exception reports: Own and take corrective action on high-priority exceptions.

The impact you will make in this role

  • You will improve payout accuracy, GL health, and accrual quality.
  • You will drive completion of tasks within defined SLAs and quality standards.
  • You will implement process improvements and maintain robust documentation.
  • You will serve as a trusted contact for divisions and BG CC on CIP matters.

Qualifications

Your Skills and Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:

  • A graduate degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.
  • At least 2 years of experience related to incentives, rebates/MDF, finance operations, or similar.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral. • Highly customer service and quality-oriented mindset.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel.

Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:

  • Experience building and maintaining incentive agreements and leading accrual meetings.
  • Familiarity with ERP/CIP tools (e.g., SAP/Vistex) and CRM (e.g., Salesforce).
  • Knowledge of Power BI, Excel macros/VBA, or basic coding.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Continuous improvement mindset and experience with UAT/system testing.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

title: Bilingual Pricing Analyst
description: Collaborate with innovative 3Mers around the world. At 3M, we apply science in collaborative ways to improve lives daily. With $24 billion in sales, our 90,000 employees connect with customers all around the world. Department Overview the Pricing Operations Team is part of Global Operations. title: Channel Sales Representative for Collision Repair, Monterrey, Mexico
description:
Job Description:

Collaborate with innovative 3Mers around the world

As you will play a key role in . In this role you will be able Channel Sales Representative for Collision Repair, driving sales growth, profitability, and market share through effective channel management and distributor engagement to develop strong relationships with key partners in the automotive aftermarket sector, ensuring the implementation of 3M’s commercial strategies, and supporting distribution networks in delivering value through innovative 3M solutions for collision repair.

The impact you will make in this role

  • You will develop and manage relationships with distributors, wholesalers and paint companies within the collision repair ecosystem.
  • You will provide training to distributors and implement 3M commercial programs to achieve sales and profitability targets.
  • You will drive demand generation through the effective use of Marketing Development Funds to support the adoption of 3M solutions and increase loyalty in body shops and paint jobbers.
  • You will monitor distributor performance, inventory levels, and sell-out data to ensure effective channel execution.
  • You will gather voice-of-customer insights and conduct market analysis to identify new business opportunities and channel development areas
  • You will coordinate with end user sales team, activation marketing, portfolio leaders, application engineering, customer service, credit & collections and supply chain teams to deliver high-quality customer service and operational excellence.
  • You will ensure compliance with 3M’s policies, pricing structures, and ethical business standards.

Your Skills and Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Marketing, Engineering, or related field.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in channel sales, distribution management, or B2B sales in the automotive aftermarket or industrial sector.
  • Intermediate to advanced English required.

Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:

  • Knowledge of automotive refinish or collision repair processes preferred
  • Proficiency in Customer Relationship Management tools and Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Strong communication, negotiation, and analytical abilities; goal-oriented and customer-focused mindset; ability to work independently and cross-functionally.
  • Willingness to travel within assigned territory. Valid driver’s license.

Work Location: This position is remote, based in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon with frequent travel required across key territories within Mexico to visit distributors, key accounts, and end-users. The role may include periodic in-person meetings or training sessions aligned with 3M’s business needs and remote work policies.

Relocation: Not authorized

Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Chat with Max

For assistance with searching through our current job openings or for more information about all things 3M, visit Max, our virtual recruiting assistant on 3M careers.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Please access the linked document by clicking select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application, you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms. here

title: Maschinenbediener / Anlagenführer (m/w/*)
description:
Safety is a core value at 3M. All employees are expected to contribute to a strong Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) culture by following safety policies, identifying hazards, and engaging in continuous improvement. At 3M, we believe diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race/ethnicity, nationality, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, matters, age or disability, or any other relevant characteristic protected under applicable local law. Job Description:

Ihr Beitrag zu unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg

Als am Standort Kempten haben Sie die Möglichkeit Ihr Wissen zielgerichtet einzusetzen, um unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg voranzubringen. Dabei umfasst Ihr Aufgabengebiet: Maschinenbediener / Anlagenführer (m/w/*)

 • Selbstständiges Einrichten und sicheres Bedienen der
 • Bereitsstellung notwendiger Materialen sowie regelmäßiges Reinigen und Rüsten der Anlagen gemäß aktueller Arbeitsanweisungen.
 • Aktive Mitarbeit bei der Verbesserung von Prozessen und Anlagen; Unterstützung der Instandhaltung bei Störungen und Wartungsarbeiten.
 • Durchführung von Qualitätsprüfungen und Sicherstellung der Einhaltung unserer Qualitätsstandards.
 • Verantwortlichkeit für lückenlose Dokumentation und Berichterstattung im Rahmen der betrieblichen Datenerfassung.

Das sind Ihre Kompetenzen

Die dieser Rolle umfassen: Mindestqualifikationen

 • Erfolgreich abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung.
 • Relevante Berufserfahrung in der Maschinenbedienung.
 • Gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.
 • Bereitschaft im 5-Schicht-Betrieb zu arbeiten.

Diese weiteren Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil:

 • CNC-Kenntnisse (Simunerik) sowie Erfahrung im Bereich Erodieren
 • Kenntnisse aller sowie technisches Verständnis.
 • Gutes Qualitätsverständnis und Grundlagen des
 • Sie besitzen gute PC-Kenntnisse (MS-Office, SAP etc.).
 • Teamfähigkeit mit ausgeprägter
 • Schnelle Auffassungsgabe und ein hohes Maß an Flexibilität.

Stellenbezogene Informationen

 • Schichtbetrieb.
 • vor Ort.

## Area Sales Manager
 
[Apply](https://3m.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Search/job/ID-Dki-Jakarta-Selatan/Area-Sales-Manager_R01160107-1/apply)
 
Remote
 
ID, Dki Jakarta Selatan
 
Full time
 
Posted 7 Days Ago
 
R01160107
 
3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas.  Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter. Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn @3M. Safety is a core value at 3M. All employees are expected to contribute to a strong Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) culture by following safety policies, identifying hazards, and engaging in continuous improvement. Job Description:
 
The incumbent will provide Personal Safety (PPE) solutions and assistance to end customers, users and other contractual party and channel personnel, for Kalimantan and other East Indonesia area. The incumbent will interface with all levels of customers in Mining & Oil and Gas industries, Cement Industries, Construction, Chemicals, and other General Industrial Segments.
 
This position is based in Balikpapan
 
Responsibilities:
 
  • Develop opportunities and business in Kalimantan and other East Indonesia area add-on
  • Proactive customer contact to Priority Accounts
  • Collaborate with Channel partner to prioritize effort in Product Spec-in and monitor contractual tender
 
Requirements:
 
  • Has a Bachelor's degree from an accredited University or experience diploma graduated is also welcome
  • Has no less than 3 - 5 years of experience in field sales
  • Certified AK3 (or any safety education) will be advantage
  • Has significant experience with industrial customers especially in Accounts
  • A self-driven and highly motivated person with the initiative and want to learn the desired traits
  • Has the ability to make formal presentations to all levels of the organization, customers and peers
  • Good communication and team work
  • Independent (able to work in the field with minimum supervision)
  • Fluent in English
