title: Specialist Operational Excellence (m/w/*)
description:
Ihr Beitrag zu unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg

Als am Standort Hilden haben Sie die Möglichkeit Ihr Wissen zielgerichtet einzusetzen, um unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg voranzubringen. Dabei umfasst Ihr Aufgabengebiet: Specialist Operational Excellence (m/w/*)

  • Entwicklung und Implementierung von Produktionssystemen zur Optimierung der Fertigungsprozesse.
  • Analyse bestehender Produktionsabläufe und Identifizierung von
  • Einführung von zur Steigerung der Effizienz und Reduzierung von Verschwendung.
  • Zusammenarbeit mit interdisziplinären Teams zur Umsetzung von Best Practices in der Fertigung mit europäischen und globalen
  • Überwachung und Visualisierung der und Erstellung von Berichten zur Leistungsmessung.

Das sind Ihre Kompetenzen

Die dieser Rolle umfassen: Mindestqualifikationen

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Ingenieurwesen, Produktionstechnik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation.
  • Fundierte Berufserfahrung in der oder einem ähnlichen Bereich.
  • Tiefgreifende Kenntnisse in der Implementierung  und Entwicklung von Produktionssystemen sowie in Lean-Management und kontinuierlicher Verbesserung.
  • Erfahrung im Coaching von Teams und Führungskräfte im Rahmen der Entwicklung von Produktionssystemen.
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.

Diese weiteren Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil:

  • Erfahrung im Automotive-Bereich sowie Kenntnisse der IATF 16949.
  • Gute Kenntnisse in SAP oder ähnlichen ERP-Systemen, sowie der Digitalisierung von Reports mit z.B. PowerBi
  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Standardisierung von Prozessen.
  • Gute Kenntnisse von Continuous und Projektmanagement.
  • Kenntnisse in der Prozessdatenanalyse.

Stellenbezogene Informationen

  • Hilden, vor Ort.
  • Reiseanteil: Gelegentliche internationale Dienstreisen möglich.

title: Senior Product Development Engineer (m/f/*)

hours.details: Full time; On-site; Travel up to 15%

description:
Safety is a core value at 3M. All employees are expected to contribute to a strong Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) culture by following safety policies, identifying hazards, and engaging in continuous improvement. At 3M, we believe diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race/ethnicity, nationality, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, matters, age or disability, or any other relevant characteristic protected under applicable local law. Job Description:

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As a Senior Product Development Engineer (m/f/*) Displays and Electronics Product Platform Auto Lab, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. at

Here, you will make an impact by:

  • Developing state of the art optical films for automotive application such as glazing and displays.
  • Designing laboratory experiments and simulations to prove or discard working hypotheses, perform root cause analysis, support problem solving process, evaluate performance vs. customer requirements or product optimization.
  • Using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools to evaluate experimental, simulation or field results and data, producing deep, accurate and reliable fact-based reports and presentations. Communicating those results and analysis to relevant stakeholders.
  • Establishing and cultivating an extensive network of support within the company and through continuous interactions with outside organizations and partners.
  • Frequently interacting with customers to better understand customer requirements, processes and applications.
  • Contributing to technology scouting and product roadmaps.
  • Supporting and leading cross-functional teams, collaborating with R&D, sales, marketing, and production teams to provide technical guidance and support, ensuring projects are delivered on time, within budget, and with the highest quality.

Your Skills and Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who meet following minimum requirements:

  • Master’s degree in relevant engineering, physics, optics or other scientific field from an accredited institution.
  • Substantial experience in optical systems, or automotive/aerospace glazing or displays, especially in product development or R&D.
  • Deep understanding of optical physics and experience with optical laboratory equipment, measurement and characterization and test methods development.
  • Good knowledge of Design of Experiments and strong data analysis capabilities, including but not limited to statistical software use.
  • Fluent in English and German.

Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:

  • PhD. degree in relevant engineering, physics, optics or other scientific field from an accredited institution.
  • Good photography and image quality understanding and processing skills.
  • Ability to write image processing related code in Phyton or other equivalent programming language would be highly helpful.
  • Deep understanding of automotive glazing quality and optical concepts, typical requirements, standards, metrics and measurement devices.
  • Knowledge of manufacturing processes relevant to automotive glazing or displays, such as lamination, glass processing, or coating technologies.
  • Strong communication, problem-solving, and skills with experience in cross-functional, global organizations.

Job specifics:

  • Location: Neuss, Germany.
  • Based on site.
  • Full time.
  • Travel: may include up to 15%

Does this opportunity and our innovative 3M culture align with your career aspirations?

If so, we encourage you to apply and embark on a journey of creativity and growth with us.

We look forward to hearing from you!

PLEASE APPLY UPLOADING YOUR RESUME IN ENGLISH. THANK YOU!

Resources for You

For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at If you have further questions please reach out to Max (our AI Virtual Assistant) via our Career Page. 3M.com/careers.

Safety is a core value at 3M. All employees are expected to contribute to a strong Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) culture by following safety policies, identifying hazards, and engaging in continuous improvement. At 3M, we believe diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race/ethnicity, nationality, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, matters, age or disability, or any other relevant characteristic protected under applicable local law. Job Description:
 
De impact die je hebt in deze rol
 
Als voor Zwijndrecht, België krijg je de gelegenheid om je nieuwsgierigheid nuttig in te zetten en samen te werken met enkele van de meest innovatieve en diverse mensen ter wereld. Hier maak je als volgt impact: Onderhoudstechnieker (m/v/*)
 
  • Uitvoeren van mechanisch herstellingen (curatief) en preventief onderhoudswerk (inspekties, enz...) aan de installaties.
  • Uitvoeren van revisiewerk (vnl. Pompen etc.)
  • Diagnose stellen en structureel verbeteren van hoogtechnologische installaties.
  • Ondersteunen van projecten met de opstart van nieuwe of aangepaste processen op vlak van mechanica, hydraulica & pneumatica.
 
Je vaardigheden en expertise
 
  • Je hebt een bachelor in elektro-mechanica of onderhoudstechnieken
  • Een sterke kennis van draaiend equipment (pompen, uitlijnen, motoren, enz...)
  • Je kan zelfstandig en efficiënt werken maar ook in team kan je vlot functioneren.
  • Je hebt een analytische geest om fouten te detecteren en om gepaste correctieve acties te nemen tem de borging (aanpassen PO-plan, magazijn)
  • Je hebt een positieve ingesteldheid è constructieve samenwerking met collega’s en produktie.
  • Relevante ervaring is een pluspunt maar geen noodzaak.
  • Mogelijkheid in ploegen (V/L) werken als shiftman.
 
Ondersteuning van je welzijn
 
Een eerlijk, prestatiegericht en concurrerend salaris is fundamenteel voor 3M. Om aantrekkelijk te blijven voor de beste talenten, monitoren we regelmatig de standaarden in de markt. Daarnaast worden afhankelijk van functie en locatie diverse sociale voorzieningen aangeboden, waaronder bijvoorbeeld aanvullende salariscomponenten zoals vakantiegeld, een bedrijfspensioen en voorzieningen volgens CAO (indien van toepassing)- en andere overeenkomsten.

Als am Standort Hilden haben Sie die Möglichkeit Ihr Wissen zielgerichtet einzusetzen, um unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg voranzubringen. Dabei umfasst Ihr Aufgabengebiet: (m/w/*)

  • Sie realisieren im Bereich der Prozessautomation.
  • Sie implementieren Inspektionssysteme und entwickeln sie weiter.
  • Sie verbinden und Vernetzen unsere Produktionsanlagen für die Realisierung von Industrie 4.0.
  • Sie betreiben aktives Projektmanagement und moderieren in der Umsetzung.
  • Sie arbeiten strategische und projektbezogen mit globalen Engineering- und IT-Partnern zusammen.

Das sind Ihre Kompetenzen

Die dieser Rolle umfassen: Mindestqualifikationen

  • Sie besitzen ein abgeschlossenes Ingenieurs-Studium der und Regelungstechnik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
  • Sie können Erfahrung im Bereich von Inspektionssystemen vorweisen.
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.

Diese weiteren Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil:

  • Praktische Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Datenbanksystemen, APIs und Kommunikation in der
  • Erste Kenntnisse in dem Bereich Six Sigma/Lean Management.
  • Sie besitzen gute Kenntnisse in MS-Office Anwendungen
  • Kenntnisse von Programmiersprachen, SPS Erfahrung mit OT Systemen.

Stellenbezogene Informationen

  • Hilden, vor Ort

title: Adv. Trademark Assistant
description: Adv. Trademark Assistant. The Adv. Trademark Assistant will be part of the Global Legal Service Center (GLSC) and will support the Trademark Work Group, which assists 3M to obtain, maintain, and enforce 3M’s brands. The Adv. Trademark Assistant will report to the GLSC Trademark Work Group lead and work closely with the Global Trademark Team. The Advance Trademark Assistant is an experienced Intellectual Property professional with substantive knowledge of trademark frameworks across different geographies. Responsibilities include Online Enforcement (conduct regular reviews of URLs, websites, and e-commerce platforms that may infringe 3M trademarks), Domain and Website Monitoring (review and manage 3M owned domain names to prevent unauthorized use), Trademark Docketing (track and manage the statuses of trademark applications and registrations), and other duties described in the listing. Skills include a bachelor’s degree in law, 3-5 years of trademark prosecution experience, IP management system experience, familiarity with e-commerce platforms and online brand monitoring tools, strong analytical and organizational abilities.
responsibilities: Online Enforcement: Conduct regular reviews of URLs, websites, and e-commerce platforms that may infringe 3M trademarks.
Execute manual searches for trademark misuses on various websites and search engines.
Domain and Website Monitoring: Review and manage 3M owned domain names to prevent unauthorized use.
Review and research evidence/documents to analyze the overall fact pattern of claim and synthesize data to establish a case
Database Management: Utilize the trademark brand protection database for tagging and updating.
Maintain a portfolio of domains and social media accounts.
Manage and prioritize a large and varied case load effectively and efficiently.
Copyright and Compliance: Review images and content for unauthorized use.
Conduct status checks for compliance of enforcement matters and ensure adherence to brand guidelines.

Renewal of 3M’s trademark assets globally: Work with the Global Trademark Team and 3M’s businesses to confirm mark is in use for the goods and services provided and renew the mark in various governmental offices around the world where the mark has been registered.

Trademark Docketing: Track and manage the statuses of trademark applications and registrations, including tracking deadlines, filings, office action responses from governmental agencies to maintain 3M’s trademark rights.
requirements: Possess a bachelor’s degree in law with high academic credentials from an accredited institution.
Minimum of three (3) to five (5) years of trademark prosecution and/or watch notice experience
IP Management System experience, preferably Anaqua and trademark brand protection databases such as Corsearch.
Familiarity with e-commerce platforms and online brand monitoring tools.
Strong analytical, communication, attention to details and project management skills.
Ability to influence and collaborate with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills; ability to establish priorities, balance multiple tasks and deadlines at one time and effectively manage competing priorities.

We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas.  Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter. Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn @3M. Safety is a core value at 3M. All employees are expected to contribute to a strong Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) culture by following safety policies, identifying hazards, and engaging in continuous improvement. Job Description:
 
Adv. Trademark Assistant
 
The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
 
The Adv. Trademark Assistant will be part of the Global Legal Service Center (GLSC) and will support the Trademark Work Group, which assists 3M to obtain, maintain, and enforce 3M’s brands
 
The Adv. Trademark Assistant will report to the GLSC Trademark Work Group lead and work closely with the Global Trademark Team. The Advance Trademark Assistant is an experienced Intellectual Property professional with substantive knowledge of trademark frameworks across different geographies.
 
Responsibilities:
 
  • Online Enforcement: • Conduct regular reviews of URLs, websites, and e-commerce platforms that may infringe 3M trademarks.
  • Execute manual searches for trademark misuses on various websites and search engines.
  • Domain and Website Monitoring: • Review and manage 3M owned domain names to prevent unauthorized use.
  • Review and research evidence/documents to analyze the overall fact pattern of claim and synthesize data to establish a case
  • Database Management: • Utilize the trademark brand protection database for tagging and updating.
  • Maintain a portfolio of domains and social media accounts.
  • Manage and prioritize a large and varied case load effectively and efficiently.
  • Copyright and Compliance: • Review images and content for unauthorized use.
  • Conduct status checks for compliance of enforcement matters and ensure adherence to brand guidelines.
  • Renewal of 3M’s trademark assets globally: • Work with the Global Trademark Team and 3M’s businesses to confirm mark is in use for the goods and services provided and renew the mark in various governmental offices around the world where the mark has been registered.
 
  • Trademark Docketing: • Track and manage the statuses of trademark applications and registrations, including tracking deadlines, filings, office action responses from governmental agencies to maintain 3M’s trademark rights.
 
Your Skills and Expertise
 
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:
 
  • Possess a bachelor’s degree in law with high academic credentials from an accredited institution.
  • Minimum of three (3) to five (5) years of trademark prosecution and/or watch notice experience
  • IP Management System experience, preferably Anaqua and trademark brand protection databases such as Corsearch.
  • Familiarity with e-commerce platforms and online brand monitoring tools.
  • Strong analytical, communication, attention to details and project management skills.
  • Ability to influence and collaborate with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders.
  • Strong organizational skills; ability to establish priorities, balance multiple tasks and deadlines at one time and effectively manage competing priorities.
 
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
 
  • Certifications or additional qualifications in IP.
  • Experience in working in teams.
  • Experience handling confidential information.
  • Experience in Multinational Corporations in a similar field of expertise.
 
: Relocation Assistance
 
  • In country relocation assistance is not authorized for this role.

title: Automated Inspection Engineer

description:
Automated Inspection Engineer

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a wide variety of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with other curious, creative 3Mers. Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military experience to a 3M career.

The Automated Inspection and Measurement group is responsible for fundamental technology development, application investigations, system integration and deployment, and long-term support across many 3M divisions in the areas of automated inspection, measurement, machine vision, automation, and process data systems. This group is a leader in digital technology within the corporation through its technology development and breadth of system deployment across 3M manufacturing operations. The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As an Automated Inspection Engineer, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:

  • Design and develop automated inspection systems using expertise areas such as optics, image processing, and AI
  • Implement and support automated inspection systems in a manufacturing environment, including travel to manufacturing locations and on-call support of systems
  • Technology development for custom inspection and measurement applications with particular emphasis on opto-mechanical systems, machine vision, and automation
  • Analyze current inspection processes and develop plans to improve detection accuracy, stability, and actionable response
  • Working within a team setting to solve manufacturing challenges

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications: Your Skills and Expertise

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Physics, or science field (completed and verified prior to start)
  • Three (3) years of experience in an engineering, manufacturing, or production environment in a private, public, government or military environment

Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:

  • Possess expertise equivalent to that which would be obtained in a master’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or related field
  • Experience in process engineering within a manufacturing or industrial setting
  • Three (3) years of professional experience implementing automated inspection or machine vision systems
  • Experience with 3M custom machine vision platforms
  • Experience with Cognex machine vision platforms
  • Experience with Zebra machine vision platforms
  • Image processing, signal processing, optics, software, or electronics experience.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, excellent networking skills, exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills.

Work location:

  • Onsite
  • Maplewood, MN

Travel: May include up to 25% US & international, primarily to 3M manufacturing locations

Relocation Assistance: May be authorized

Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).

Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope. For assistance with searching through our current job openings or for more information about all things 3M, visit Max, our virtual recruiting assistant on Chat with Max 3M.com/careers.

title: National Account Executive
description: Hain Celestial Group are looking for a proactive and detail-driven National Account Executive to join our Commercial team. In this role, you will support the Head of Sales, Customer Controllers, and Customer Managers to maximise sustainable, profitable growth across Hain brands and Retail Own Label. The ideal candidate will be highly organised, confident working cross-functionally, and able to build strong relationships both internally and externally. You will play a key role in ensuring the smooth running of customer accounts and maintaining all required administration in line with internal processes and customer guidelines. Compliance with Competition Law is essential at all times.
responsibilities: Maintain accurate internal and customer administration, including volume forecasts, promotional loading and accruals, EPOS tracking, invoice price alignment, and new line form creation.
Develop expert knowledge of customer systems and processes, ensuring all information is updated in a timely manner.
Deliver sales and promotional reporting and analysis (Budget vs. YOY), providing insights to build a robust P&L.
Analyse customer EPOS data to track performance and identify trends.
Work cross-functionally across the business, including:
Reviewing market data alongside customer EPOS.
Completing NPD administration and supporting customer shopper activation proposals.
Providing accurate forecasts to support supply continuity.
Monitoring spend against budget.
requirements: A-Levels required; Degree-level qualification preferred.
Ideally 2+ years’ experience in a comparable industry.
Experience within sales or a commercial environment, with broad product and process understanding.
Strong communication skills, internally and externally.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to multitask.
Effective project management capabilities.
Results-focused with the ability to work at pace.
Commercially aware with confidence dealing with customers.
Proven track record in building strong customer and supplier relationships.
Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills.
benefits: Competitive salary / rate of pay
Hybrid Working Option
25 days annual leave, plus 8 Bank Holiday
Option to purchase additional annual leave
A day off work to support our charity partners
Flexible working options
Pension
Medical benefit
Access to a HUB that offers discounts from a range of suppliers and retailers
company_info:
About The Hain Celestial Group: Hain Celestial Group is a leading health and wellness company whose purpose is to inspire healthier living for people, communities and the planet through better-for-you brands. For more than 30 years, our portfolio of beloved brands has intentionally focused on delivering nutrition and well-being that positively impacts today and tomorrow. Headquartered in Hoboken, N.J., Hain Celestial’s products across snacks, baby/kids, beverages, meal preparation, and personal care, are marketed and sold in over 75 countries around the world. Our leading brands include Garden Veggie™ snacks, Terra® chips, Garden of Eatin’® snacks, Earth’s Best® and Ella’s Kitchen® baby and kids foods, Celestial Seasonings® teas, Joya® and Natumi® plant-based beverages, Greek Gods® yogurt, Cully & Sully®, Imagine® and New Covent Garden® soups, Yves® and Linda McCartney’s® (under license) meat-free, and Alba Botanica® natural sun care, among others.

Hain Celestial Group
In the UK, Hain is one of the UK's leading food companies. We create food and drink products with natural goodness at their core. We're the business behind a host of household brands - Hartley's jams and jellies, Sun-Pat peanut butters, New Covent Garden Soup Co., Linda McCartney's meat free food, and Yorkshire Provender to name a few. Nearly half of our business is private label - we create quality freshly prepared fruit and juices, desserts, soups, sweet spreads and meat free products for our retail partners.

Over our sites up and down the UK, we employ circa 1,200 people in roles within Production, Supply Chain, Product Development, Sales and Marketing, and through to our Finance, HR, IT and beyond. Each of our colleagues is vital to our continued success. That's why we target the best talent, and help to develop them through the ranks.

Our Values
Own It – I am empowered and accountable for improving Hain’s business results and impact
Win Together – I collaborate with others to grow, deliver and celebrate success.
Foster Inclusion – I create an environment where everyone feels welcome, respected and valued for their uniqueness.
Be Curious – I explore ideas & insights with a growth mindset.

Our Purpose
To inspire healthier living for people, communities & the planet through better-for-you brands

Our Mission

## National Account Executive
 
Location:
 
Home Based
 
Vacancy Type:
 
Permanent
 
[Apply](https://www.haindaniels.careers/vacancies/vacancy-apply.aspx?VacancyID=2361)
 [Back to results](https://www.haindaniels.careers/vacancies/vacancy-search-results.aspx)
 
## Advert:
 
Location: Homebased / United Kingdom
 
Hain Celestial, producers of many household food brands such as Hartley’s, Ella’s Kitchen, Robertson’s, Sun-Pat, Yorkshire Provender, Cully & Sully, Linda McCartney’s, Farmhouse Fare and many more, are looking for a proactive and detail-driven National Account Executive to join our Commercial team. In this role, you will support the Head of Sales, Customer Controllers, and Customer Managers to maximise sustainable, profitable growth across Hain brands and Retail Own Label.
 
The ideal candidate will be highly organised, confident working cross-functionally, and able to build strong relationships both internally and externally. You will play a key role in ensuring the smooth running of customer accounts and maintaining all required administration in line with internal processes and customer guidelines. Compliance with Competition Law is essential at all times.
 
Key Responsibilities
 
  • Maintain accurate internal and customer administration, including volume forecasts, promotional loading and accruals, EPOS tracking, invoice price alignment, and new line form creation.
  • Develop expert knowledge of customer systems and processes, ensuring all information is updated in a timely manner.
  • Deliver sales and promotional reporting and analysis (Budget vs. YOY), providing insights to build a robust P&L.
  • Analyse customer EPOS data to track performance and identify trends.
  • Work cross-functionally across the business, including:
 
  • Reviewing market data alongside customer EPOS.
  • Completing NPD administration and supporting customer shopper activation proposals.
  • Providing accurate forecasts to support supply continuity.
  • Monitoring spend against budget.
 

## Education & Experience
 
  • A-Levels required; Degree-level qualification preferred.
  • Ideally 2+ years’ experience in a comparable industry.
  • Experience within sales or a commercial environment, with broad product and process understanding.
 

## Skills & Competencies
 
  • Strong communication skills, internally and externally.
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to multitask.
  • Effective project management capabilities.
  • Results-focused with the ability to work at pace.
  • Commercially aware with confidence dealing with customers.
  • Proven track record in building strong customer and supplier relationships.
  • Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills.
 

## Scope & Accountability
 
  • Indirect management of agreed spend.
  • Contribute positively towards NSV, EBITDA, and Balanced Scorecard targets.
  • Approve customer invoices within pre-agreed budgets.
  • Update sales forecasts with guidance from the Customer Manager.
  • Complete promotion nominations in line with Finance/Category/Marketing guidelines.
  • Prepare weekly and monthly customer performance reports.
  • Maintain awareness of customer and competitor landscapes, sharing insights internally.
 
What we can offer you
 
  • Competitive salary / rate of pay
  • Hybrid Working Option
  • 25 days annual leave, plus 8 Bank Holiday
  • Option to purchase additional annual leave
  • A day off work to support our charity partners
  • Flexible working options
  • Pension
  • Medical benefit
  • And access to a HUB that offers many discounts from a range of suppliers and retailers
 
About The Hain Celestial Group
 
Hain Celestial Group is a leading health and wellness company whose purpose is to inspire healthier living for people, communities and the planet through better-for-you brands. For more than 30 years, our portfolio of beloved brands has intentionally focused on delivering nutrition and well-being that positively impacts today and tomorrow. Headquartered in Hoboken, N.J., Hain Celestial’s products across snacks, baby/kids, beverages, meal preparation, and personal care, are marketed and sold in over 75 countries around the world. Our leading brands include Garden Veggie™ snacks, Terra® chips, Garden of Eatin’® snacks, Earth’s Best® and Ella’s Kitchen® baby and kids foods, Celestial Seasonings® teas, Joya® and Natumi® plant-based beverages, Greek Gods® yogurt, Cully & Sully®, Imagine® and New Covent Garden® soups, Yves® and Linda McCartney’s® (under license) meat-free, and Alba Botanica® natural sun care, among others.
 
Hain Celestial Group
 
In the UK,  Hain is one of the UK's leading food companies. We create food and drink products with natural goodness at their core. We're the business behind a host of household brands - Hartley's jams and jellies, Sun-Pat peanut butters, New Covent Garden Soup Co., Linda McCartney's meat free food, and Yorkshire Provender to name a few. Nearly half of our business is private label - we create quality freshly prepared fruit and juices, desserts, soups, sweet spreads and meat free products for our retail partners.
 
Over our sites up and down the UK, we employ circa 1,200 people in roles within Production, Supply Chain, Product Development, Sales and Marketing, and through to our Finance, HR, IT and beyond. Each of our colleagues is vital to our continued success. That's why we target the best talent, and help to develop them through the ranks.
 
Our Values
 
Own It – I am empowered and accountable for improving Hain’s business results and impact
 
Win Together – I collaborate with others to grow, deliver and celebrate success.
 
Foster Inclusion – I create an environment where everyone feels welcome, respected and valued for their uniqueness.
 
Be Curious – I explore ideas & insights with a growth mindset.
 
Our Purpose
 
To inspire healthier living for people, communities & the planet through better-for-you brands
 
Our Mission
 
To build purpose-driven brands that make healthier living more attainable by empowering our people, engaging our partners, and living our lives.
 
If you need reasonable adjustments made to the recruitment process, please let us know so we can support you in the right way.
 
If Hain Celestial sounds like the company you'd like to contribute your energy and enthusiasm towards, and come on an exciting journey with us, then we can't wait to hear from you!

Are you ready to shape how shoppers across the UK engage with some of the nation’s best-loved food brands? Hain Celestial - home to a powerhouse portfolio of iconic names, is looking for a passionate to help get our brands into even more shopping baskets.
 
This is an exciting opportunity to work directly with brands that are trusted by families, food lovers and households nationwide, including , , , , , , , and many others that have helped define the UK food landscape.
 
Join us and help shape category growth, drive impact at point of purchase, and deliver shopper marketing that truly wins.
 
---
 

## The Role
 
Reporting to the Shopper Marketing Controller, you’ll develop and deliver annual shopper marketing plans with key UK customers—unlocking growth, visibility and shopper conversion for Hain’s strategic brands.
 
This role works hand-in-hand with Customer Managers and cross-functional teams, ensuring that our brands show up powerfully across customer media ecosystems and in-store.
 
---
 

## What You’ll Be Doing
 

### Customer Marketing Execution
 
  • Build, plan and execute annual media plans with selected retailers.
  • Deliver against the 5 Ps: —with shopper mission and retailer strategy at the heart.
  • Partner with customer teams to align plans to joint business objectives, ensuring media investment is efficient and effective.
  • Activate key initiatives and NPD moments, bringing our Gold/Silver/Bronze brand priorities to life.
 

### Customer Insights, Evaluation & Budget Ownership
 
  • Manage monthly field sales reviews to ensure strong in-store POS compliance.
  • Work with insight teams to evaluate performance, ROI and learnings.
  • Own and monitor customer shopper marketing budgets, ensuring spend always reflects live plans.
 

### Trade Marketing & Cross-Functional Collaboration
 
  • Build strong, credible relationships with retailers and key agencies (e.g. Dunnhumby).
  • Create compelling sell-in stories for brand initiatives and NPD.
  • Support customer-facing brand sells and commercial meetings.
 

### Champion of the Shopper & Customer
 
  • Bring the and into the business.
  • Understand shopper behaviour, missions and needs—ensuring our brands meet them brilliantly.
  • Drive best-in-class execution across all touchpoints.
 
---
 

## About You
 
  • 1+ year of experience in FMCG Sales, Shopper Marketing or Brand Marketing.
  • Strong commercial acumen with excellent communication and relationship-building skills.
  • Ability to work cross-functionally and remotely.
  • Confident using shopper insights, retailer data and Excel to build compelling recommendations.
  • Highly organised, able to juggle priorities and deliver outstanding execution.
  • A natural storyteller with strong presentation skills.
 
---
 

## What You’ll Influence
 
  • Shopper marketing plans for some of the UK’s most iconic food brands.

People & Culture

### What we can offer you

#### Why Join Us?
 
At Ella’s Kitchen, we’re all about doing business the right way—making the world a healthier, happier place for little ones. You’ll join a collaborative, purpose-led team where ideas are valued, curiosity is encouraged, and every day is an opportunity to make an impact.

## Advert:
 
As a you'll be working across the Hain Celestial and Ella's Kitchen portfolios, to lead and own the digital shelf. You'll work closely with third party Ecom tool partners and support the wider Ecom team by managing day to day trading of existing customers.
 
You'll be a great relationship builder, with the ability to influence and challenge, making sure we make the right decisions and playing a key role in ensuring we land our ambitious growth plans.  You'll be creative, ambitious and commercially savvy and will be able to demonstrate the ability to inspire and motivate your customers and fellow team members.
 
Role responsibilities
 
• Ecommerce Account Management (3 0 %)
 
• Manage key online grocery accounts, driving commercial performance and account growth in line with our budget
  • • Gain a real understanding of your customers strategies & goals and align them to our plans .
  • • Ensure our trade spend is managed effectively. Analyse customer-level data and campaign results to optimise commercial return
  • • Deliver JBP terms with support from the International Ecommerce Manager
  • Work collaboratively with Marketing to drive our direct-to-consumer business, through optimised online promotional plans and aligning key brand moments in time to our own website
 
• Drive the ecommerce strategy ( 30 %)
 
• • Help us to deliver our E-Commerce strategy with support and guidance from the International Ecommerce Manager
 
• • Ensure brilliant basics across product listings, imagery, taxonomy, and availability
  • • Work closely with the third party ecom tool partners to make data lead decisions and drive ownership in sales and marketing
  • • Analyse customer-level data and campaign results to optimise commercial return
  • Work closely with our shopper marketing team to execute a sponsored search plan alongside online activation plans across the top 4 retailers
 
• Sales F undamentals / Reporting & Tracking (20%)
 
• • Work with our category and marketing teams to deliver timely category management/insight to help deliver targets and help stand us apart from the rest of our competition
  • • Accurately report sales data (weekly sales number, forecasting, trade spend, promotional performance)
  • • Manage and contribute to a broad range of cross functional projects
  • • You are the eyes and ears of your customers. You stay up to date with what is going on in store and online
 
• Ecom Sales Support (20%)
  • • Support the wider Ecom team managing day to day trading of existing customers – debit note management, media activation, promo administration, delivering CPI, tender preparation and ecom reporting
 
You will need to:
 
  • Have experience managing customers, delivering commercial plans and results ( preferably within E-Commerce)
  • Be p assion ate and enthusiastic about driving growth in Ecom
  • Demonstra te your ability to live and breathe our values: Own it, Foster i nclusion, Be Curious and Win Together
  • Have a willingness to learn and be challenged to think differently
  • Successful in managing stakeholders and communicating across various levels and functions.
  • Strong business, financial, and analytical skills with a solutions-driven approach .
  • Be a proactive thinker
  • Be a b le to thrive in an entrepreneurial and exciting environment
  • Have a results focussed mind - set with the ability to “never give up” and find solutions to challenges
  • Articulate with e xcellent presentation skills . Be able to i nfluence others through your flexible style
  • Have a great grasp of MS O ffice (Excel in particular)
 
What can we offer you?
 
  • Competitive salary / rate of pay
  • 25 days annual leave, plus 8 Bank Holiday
  • Option to purchase additional annual leave
  • A day off work to support our charity partners
  • Flexible working options
  • Pension
  • Medical benefit
  • And access to a HUB that offers many discounts from a range of suppliers and retailers
 
About The Hain Celestial Group
 
Hain Celestial Group is a leading health and wellness company whose purpose is to inspire healthier living for people, communities and the planet through better-for-you brands. For more than 30 years, our portfolio of beloved brands has intentionally focused on delivering nutrition and well-being that positively impacts today and tomorrow. Headquartered in Hoboken, N.J., Hain Celestial’s products across snacks, baby/kids, beverages, meal preparation, and personal care, are marketed and sold in over 75 countries around the world. Our leading brands include Garden Veggie™ snacks, Terra® chips, Garden of Eatin’® snacks, Earth’s Best® and Ella’s Kitchen® baby and kids foods, Celestial Seasonings® teas, Joya® and Natumi® plant-based beverages, Greek Gods® yogurt, Cully & Sully®, Imagine® and New Covent Garden® soups, Yves® and Linda McCartney’s® (under license) meat-free, and Alba Botanica® natural sun care, among others.
 
Hain Celestial UK
 
In the UK,  Hain is one of the UK's leading food companies. We create food and drink products with natural goodness at their core. We're the business behind a host of household brands - Hartley's jams and jellies, Sun-Pat peanut butters, New Covent Garden Soup Co., Linda McCartney's meat free food, and Yorkshire Provender to name a few. Nearly half of our business is private label - we create quality freshly prepared fruit and juices, desserts, soups, sweet spreads and meat free products for our retail partners.
 
Over our sites up and down the UK, we employ circa 1,200 people in roles within Production, Supply Chain, Product Development, Sales and Marketing, and through to our Finance, HR, IT and beyond. Each of our colleagues is vital to our continued success. That's why we target the best talent, and help to develop them through the ranks.
 
Our Values
 
Own It – I am empowered and accountable for improving Hain’s business results and impact
 
Win Together – I collaborate with others to grow, deliver and celebrate success.
 
Foster Inclusion – I create an environment where everyone feels welcome, respected and valued for their uniqueness.
 
Be Curious – I explore ideas & insights with a growth mindset.
 
Our Purpose
 
To inspire healthier living for people, communities & the planet through better-for-you brands
 
Our Mission
 
To build purpose-driven brands that make healthier living more attainable by empowering our people, engaging our partners, and living our lives.
 
If you need reasonable adjustments made to the recruitment process, please let us know so we can support you in the right way.
 
If Hain Celestial sounds like the company you'd like to contribute your energy and enthusiasm towards, and come on an exciting journey with us, then we can't wait to hear from you!

title: Financial Business Partner
description: Advert: Location: Leeds (LS15) - Hybrid. We are seeking a highly driven Commercial Finance professional to join our Leeds team. Acting as a strategic partner to senior commercial leaders, you will play a pivotal role in shaping commercial decisions, driving revenue and EBITDA growth, and enhancing financial performance across multiple categories. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced commercial finance professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys influencing business strategy, and excels at providing high-impact financial insight.
responsibilities: Partner with the Senior Commercial Team to provide actionable insight that drives strategic decision-making.
Lead commercial initiatives and profit improvement projects.
Attend weekly trading meetings, monthly exec reviews, and customer performance meetings.
Support and challenge business stakeholders to unlock value and improve margin performance.
Lead period-end postings for sales-related revenue and expenses, including sales, standard costs, and trade investment.
Support management accounting processes to ensure accurate and timely financial reporting.
Analyse brand revenue and profitability across multiple categories.
Produce sales performance commentary and evaluate promotional effectiveness.
Build and enhance business models (e.g., EBITDA by brand/factory).
Lead the UK costing process and support CPI calculations.
Support Integrated Business Planning (IBP), including Integrated Reconciliation.
Manage annual budgeting and quarterly forecasting cycles, partnering with senior NAMs and the Sales Director.
Present insights to the UK Exec and Group stakeholders.
Maintain short-term forecasts to support agile decision-making.
Support the implementation of a new sales forecasting system.
Help automate reporting using BI tools.
Contribute to transforming divisional finance structures into a simplified, functional model.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives across finance and commercial teams.
Build strong internal relationships, supporting and challenging stakeholders across procurement, supply chain, finance, and commercial teams.
Own and deliver a personal development plan with your line manager.
requirements: Degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field.
Strong commercial finance experience, ideally within FMCG.
Proven ability to lead projects and deliver profit-driving initiatives.
Strong analytical capability with experience translating data into meaningful commercial insights.
Experience supporting period-end and management accounting processes.
Professional qualification (CIMA / ACCA).
Experience with ERP systems and BI tools.
benefits: Competitive salary / rate of pay
Hybrid Working Option
25 days annual leave, plus 8 Bank Holiday
Option to purchase additional annual leave
A day off work to support our charity partners
Flexible working options
Pension
Medical benefit
And access to a HUB that offers many discounts from a range of suppliers and retailers

description: Shift Engineer role at The Hain Celestial Group. This position focuses on maintaining and improving production equipment performance in a fast-paced FMCG environment. responsibilities: Rapidly respond to breakdowns and carry out planned maintenance tasks.

Promote a clean, safe, and efficient working environment.
Drive performance by minimising downtime and ensuring optimum plant availability.
Maintain accurate documentation for all maintenance and engineering tasks.
Participate in maintenance projects, upgrades, and service improvements.
Demonstrate efficient machine operation and support operator training.
requirements: Electrical or Mechanical disciplines.
is highly desirable.

Great communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.
Self-motivated, hands-on, and solutions-focused.

Nearly half of our business is private label - we create quality freshly prepared fruit and juices, desserts, soups, sweet spreads and meat free products for our retail partners.

Over our sites up and down the UK, we employ circa 1,200 people in roles within Production, Supply Chain, Product Development, Sales and Marketing, and through to our Finance, HR, IT and beyond. Each of our colleagues is vital to our continued success. That's why we target the best talent, and help to develop them through the ranks.

Our Values

Own It – I am empowered and accountable for improving Hain’s business results and impact

Win Together – I collaborate with others to grow, deliver and celebrate success.

Foster Inclusion – I create an environment where everyone feels welcome, respected and valued for their uniqueness.

Be Curious – I explore ideas & insights with a growth mindset.

Our Purpose

To inspire healthier living for people, communities & the planet through better-for-you brands

Our Mission

To build purpose-driven brands that make healthier living more attainable by empowering our people, engaging our partners, and living our lives.

If you need reasonable adjustments made to the recruitment process, please let us know so we can support you in the right way.

If Hain sounds like the company you'd like to contribute your energy and enthusiasm towards, and come on an exciting journey with us, then we can't wait to hear from you!

## Advert:
 
: 4 on 4 off (Days or Nights) | Location : Grimsby | Shift Pattern Hours : 06:00 – 18:00 / 18:00 – 06:00
 
Are you a hands-on engineer with a passion for problem-solving and continuous improvement? Do you thrive in a fast-paced FMCG environment and want to be part of a team that values collaboration, innovation, and pride in their work?
 
This is your opportunity to make a real impact! We’re looking for a proactive and skilled to join our operations team at our . You’ll be playing a crucial role in maintaining the performance of production equipment and ensuring smooth, safe, and efficient manufacturing processes.
 
What You’ll Be Doing (Key Responsibilities):
 
  • Rapidly respond to breakdowns and carry out planned maintenance tasks.
  • Investigate root causes of failures and develop effective action plans.
  • Support continuous improvement and operational efficiency initiatives.
  • Deliver training and support to production teams for minor maintenance.
  • Collaborate across departments (Production, Technical, NPD, etc.).
  • Promote a clean, safe, and efficient working environment.
  • Drive performance by minimising downtime and ensuring optimum plant availability.
  • Maintain accurate documentation for all maintenance and engineering tasks.
  • Participate in maintenance projects, upgrades, and service improvements.
  • Demonstrate efficient machine operation and support operator training.
 

## What You’ll Need (Skills & Experience):
 
  • – Electrical or Mechanical disciplines.
  • is highly desirable.
  • Confident with .
  • Familiar with .
  • Strong computer skills – Microsoft Office proficiency essential.
  • Great communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.
  • Self-motivated, hands-on, and solutions-focused.
  • Ability to work at heights, in confined spaces, and varying temperatures.
  • Flexibility to travel to other sites or suppliers if required.
 
What can we offer you?
 
  • Competitive salary / rate of pay
  • 25 days annual leave, plus 8 Bank Holiday
  • Option to purchase additional annual leave
  • A day off work to support our charity partners
  • Flexible working options
  • Pension
  • Medical benefit
  • And access to a HUB that offers many discounts from a range of suppliers and retailers
 
About The Hain Celestial Group
 
Hain Celestial Group is a leading health and wellness company whose purpose is to inspire healthier living for people, communities and the planet through better-for-you brands. For more than 30 years, our portfolio of beloved brands has intentionally focused on delivering nutrition and well-being that positively impacts today and tomorrow. Headquartered in Hoboken, N.J., Hain Celestial’s products across snacks, baby/kids, beverages, meal preparation, and personal care, are marketed and sold in over 75 countries around the world. Our leading brands include Garden Veggie™ snacks, Terra® chips, Garden of Eatin’® snacks, Earth’s Best® and Ella’s Kitchen® baby and kids foods, Celestial Seasonings® teas, Joya® and Natumi® plant-based beverages, Greek Gods® yogurt, Cully & Sully®, Imagine® and New Covent Garden® soups, Yves® and Linda McCartney’s® (under license) meat-free, and Alba Botanica® natural sun care, among others.
 
Hain Celestial UK
 
In the UK,  Hain is one of the UK's leading food companies. We create food and drink products with natural goodness at their core. We're the business behind a host of household brands - Hartley's jams and jellies, Sun-Pat peanut butters, New Covent Garden Soup Co., Linda McCartney's meat free food, and Yorkshire Provender to name a few. Nearly half of our business is private label - we create quality freshly prepared fruit and juices, desserts, soups, sweet spreads and meat free products for our retail partners.
 
Over our sites up and down the UK, we employ circa 1,200 people in roles within Production, Supply Chain, Product Development, Sales and Marketing, and through to our Finance, HR, IT and beyond. Each of our colleagues is vital to our continued success. That's why we target the best talent, and help to develop them through the ranks.

Win Together – I collaborate with others to grow, deliver and celebrate success.
 
Foster Inclusion – I create an environment where everyone feels welcome, respected and valued for their uniqueness.
 
Be Curious – I explore ideas & insights with a growth mindset.

## Carers in Oxford
 
Job description
 
Are you looking for a company who really values their employees? At 1st Homecare we really believe in our ethos and values and follow them in all that we do.
 
1st Homecare is a growing, independent domiciliary care agency based in Oxford. We are a CQC rated Outstanding in responsiveness. We have recently been voted by clients as one of the top 20 homecare groups within the UK.
 
We are looking for naturally caring and committed individuals to join our fantastic team.
 
We at 1st Homecare offer a friendly supportive working environment, very competitive rate of pay, a paid day off for your birthday every year, a company pension, NVQ training, fully paid induction training, company mobile phone, a uniform, offer childcare vouchers and store discounts.
 
We are a progressive company who believe in their staff and help their staff to progress in furthering their careers. Experience is not essential but enjoying putting a smile on someone’s face is!
 
Being a carer is not ‘just a job’, it is a rewarding career which gives huge job satisfaction each day. You cannot beat the feeling of knowing you are making a difference to someone’s life every time you visit them.
 
1st Homecare can offer you-
 
  • Weekdays weekdays, weekends, double pay for bank holidays. (and £9.33 for 30 mins and £11.27 for 45 mins which is the equivalent of £18.66 ph and £15.02 ph) £14.61/hour £16.84/hour
  • Mileage paid at per mile from home to each client and back home. 35p
  • 4-day paid training course, located in our office which will result in you having the Care Certificate qualification.
  • Friendly and supportive working environment.
  • Values based company.
  • Paid day off for your birthday
  • Company issued smart phone with unlimited calls and texts for your own use.
  • Paid holidays
  • Company pension scheme
  • Regular supervisions and open-door policy.
  • 1st Homecare Uniform
  • Progression and growth with your career
  • The option to undertake your NVQ qualification.
  • Ongoing training, including specialist training
 
We have full and part time positions available. We are flexible around you and your family’s needs.
 
All you need is a UK driving licence and access to a car.
 
You will be working in and around Oxford.
 
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Zero hours contract
 
Benefits:
 
  • Company pension
  • Free or subsidised travel
  • Referral programme
 
Schedule:
 
  • Day shift
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

title: Carers in Leighton Buzzard

hours.details: Weekdays 3pm-10:30pm; Every other weekend is mandatory; Part-time hours: 20-60 per week; shifts include 8, 10, and 12 hour shifts; full-time and part-time positions available

description: 1st Homecare is looking for naturally caring and committed individuals to join our team of carers. Experience is not essential but enjoying putting a smile on someone’s face is! Being a carer is not ‘just a job’, it is a rewarding career which gives huge job satisfaction each day. You can’t beat the feeling of knowing you are making a difference to someone’s life every time you visit them. You won’t just be supporting people with personal care, we also like to include our clients in social activities where possible, so you could be taking a trip to the garden centre or taking their dog for a walk. We are looking to recruit people of all ages. We provide paid training. You will be working in Leighton Buzzard and surrounding villages. Please get in touch if you are ready to put a smile on someone’s face! 1st Homecare can offer you- Weekday £12.99 per hour, weekend £14.27, up to double time on bank holidays – and proportionately more for part hours. Birthday bonus (7 hours pay) paid in the month of your birthday. An additional 35p per mile paid for travel expenses. Paid blended training. Company issued smart phone with unlimited calls and texts. Paid holidays. Company pension scheme. Regular supervisions. We encourage all staff to progress in their career within care and complete an NVQ (Level 2, 3 and 5). Ongoing training, including specialist training. We have full and part time positions available. You will work to a two week rolling rota; you will know your hours of work in advance. Experience is not essential as full training will be provided. Car driver is essential.

## Carers in Kings Langley
 
COME AND JOIN US!
 
Our award winning domiciliary care company is looking for reliable and enthusiastic people to join our friendly and very experienced team
 
This is an opportunity for people who want to work in care to learn from some of the very best.
 
We are a long established family run business which has served our local community since 1994 Many of our carers have been with us for twenty plus years and we have an exceptional retention of staff record.
 
We want to invest and nurture you as we know that in order to provide our clients with first class care, we need first class carers. Even if you have no previous care experience we want to hear from you – will provide you with in house paid training as we want you to learn our way.
 
We need from you:
 
  • A passion to provide a quality care service and the enthusiasm to always go the extra mile.
  • Common sense and reliability as vulnerable elderly people will depend on you.
  • A full driving licence and a vehicle available for you to use for work.
 
And then we can offer you:

  • Because we are always mindful of client confidentiality our staff are smartly dressed but do not wear uniform

raw_text:
# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Supported Lodgings Host - South Gloucestershire
 
Supported Lodgings is a fantastic next step for young people who are nearly ready to live fully independently but need a helping hand first.  When someone offers a young person a room, it provides a supportive home environment in which they can learn and grow. Leaving care or a service can be difficult and disorientating – we believe when our young people know what it feels like to belong and be valued, they have the stability to thrive. As a host family, you would play a huge part in supporting a young person to feel valued by providing them with a bedroom for 6-24 months and helping them to feel a part of your household whilst they gain the skills they need to move into their own accommodation. We are looking for people across South Gloucestershire, who have a spare bedroom, to become host families for 16-25 year olds who are studying or working and who need somewhere to stay before moving into independent living. What is Supported Lodgings? The Young Person:
 
  • Aged 16-25 years old
  • They are in education, employment or training
  • Low support needs but may need help learning soft skills like cooking, budgeting, cleaning and shopping
  • Need compassion and understanding – they have been on a long journey!
 
The Host:
 
  • We encourage a variety of people to apply
  • We love hosts who are kind and have a passion for young people ​
  • You can provide a room in your house to be the young person's bedroom
  • You are not the young person’s only support, we will continue to provide support and social workers, or personal advisors remain involved
  • You will receive full training to become a host and be supported by our Supported Lodgings Coordinator on every step of your journey
  • Supported Lodgings is a great first step for people who are considering becoming foster carers. We have supported several hosts to make the move into fostering with relevant training and references
  • Costs are covered with a £175 per week payment for every week there is a young person in your property
 
Supported Lodgings is project run by 1625 Independent People in South Gloucestershire. We support young people across the region to reboot their lives and move to independence. . To apply for this role, please fill out this application form, and email it to . Who we are How to Apply: [Please click here to download the application form for this role](https://1625independentpeople.peoplehr.net/Handlers/RichTextEditorImageDownload.ashx?file=/Supported%20Lodgings%20Host%20Application%20Form.docx) [supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk)
 
Alternatively, you can apply on our Volunteering webpage, . If you want to know more, please . The website also has  more info about what hosting is like and what we expect from our hosts and young people.  Alternatively please email Duncan, our Supported Lodgings Coordinator for an informal chat: . [here](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/) [visit our website to apply directly](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/) [supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/)
 
​
 
We believe those with a criminal record should have an equal chance to become employees or volunteers and encourage applications. As an organisation who safeguard and promote the safety and welfare of children, young people and adults at risk, any job offer will depend on a satisfactory DBS (Disclosure and Barring Service) check. We comply fully with the DBS code of practice and undertake to treat all applications for positions fairly. For successful candidates with a criminal record, a risk assessment process will take place with the recruiting manager. We also pride ourselves on being an equal opportunities employer for everyone regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, religion and beliefs, sex and sexual orientation. Please see our section on the website, for further information. Equal opportunities for everyone [Policies](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/policies/)

description: We are excited to be recruiting an Asylum and Refugees Intensive Support worker to work alongside this established team within 1625 Independent People. As a member of the Asylum & Refugee Team, you will have the opportunity to support young asylum seekers settle into life in the UK. This is your chance to make a positive difference to the lives of some of the most vulnerable young people in our society. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritised ethnic groups, Muslim and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59, Monday 05 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing: By developing individual support plans that promote the development of independent living skills including accommodation, EET and wellbeing, you will provide support to young Asylum Seekers to ensure they successfully integrate into the local community and access the services to which they are entitled. Using your problem-solving skills, you will explore proactively move-on options with young people as you support them toward accessing and sustaining suitable alternative accommodation. Using your communication and cooperation skills, work with other involved professionals to support young Asylum Seekers through the process of seeking leave to remain in the UK By being well organised, efficient, and effective you will undertake a host of housing. management tasks including preparing properties for letting, and health and safety checks to ensure the safety of young people, colleagues, and properties.
responsibilities: Develop individual support plans promoting independent living skills, including accommodation, EET and wellbeing, to help young asylum seekers integrate and access entitled services.
Proactively explore move-on options with young people to access and sustain suitable alternative accommodation.
Collaborate with other professionals to support asylum seekers through the process of seeking leave to remain in the UK.
Undertake housing management tasks, including preparing properties for letting and conducting health and safety checks.
benefits: A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays
Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF
A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing
Disability Confident Employer and related supports referenced in the advert

# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Asylum & Refugees Intensive Support Worker
 
We are excited to be recruiting an Asylum and Refugees Intensive Support worker to work alongside this established team within 1625 Independent People.  As a member of the Asylum & Refugee Team, you will have the opportunity to support young asylum seekers settle into life in the UK. This is your chance to make a positive difference to the lives of some of the most vulnerable young people in our society. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritised ethnic groups, Muslim and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59, Monday 05 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing:
 
  • By developing individual support plans that promote the development of independent living skills including accommodation, EET and wellbeing, you will provide support to young Asylum Seekers to ensure they successfully integrate into the local community and access the services to which they are entitled.
  • Using your problem-solving skills, you will explore proactively move-on options with young people as you support them toward accessing and sustaining suitable alternative accommodation.
  • Using your communication and cooperation skills, work with other involved professionals to support young Asylum Seekers through the process of seeking leave to remain in the UK
  • By being well organised, efficient, and effective you will undertake a host of housing. management tasks including preparing properties for letting, and health and safety checks to ensure the safety of young people, colleagues, and properties.
 
You will be in the Asylum & Refugees Intensive Support team based within the wider South Gloucestershire team and your line manager will be the Asylum and Refugees (Intensive Support) Team Leader. At 1625ip we are led by our Competency Development Framework. This connects our values to our behaviours in everything we do and gives us the tools to develop. The framework ensures our recruitment is better informed, applications and interviews are behaviourally based, and job profiles are developed on the ‘how’ of a job. If you have transferrable skills and you are interested in this role, but you are worried about the application process, please get in touch with us. We encourage you to have an informal chat with the recruiting manager to discuss how your personal or professional experience and skills could be transferred to this role. Details of how you can do that are further down in this advert. Contract details:

  • Based in 1625ip’s office in Old Market, Bristol or in Patchway, South Gloucestershire, with an ability to work from other locations in Bristol and occasionally from home. This role will entail travel across Bristol and South Glos so being a driver with access to a vehicle is essential. The location:
 
In return for your dedication, we offer: A few benefits at 1625ip
 
  • A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays
  • Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF
  • A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing:
  • “I feel grateful to work here every day! The work feels useful and worthwhile, and I feel like I am able to make a difference for our young people” (From Colleague Wellbeing Survey 2023).
  • “I couldn’t be happier with the opportunities and support I have received in my career progression that has led me to my dream job!” See what other colleagues have said about their career development with us, . [here](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/about-us/work-with-us/)
  • 1625ip is a Disability Confident Employer.
 
Important dates:
 
  • Application deadline closes: . 23:59, Monday 05 January 2026
  • If you have not heard from us by the end of the day on , please assume that your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion. Thursday 08 January 2026
  • Interviews are on . Thursday 15 January 2026
 
Ready to see yourself in this rewarding role? We can’t wait to hear from you. Application information
 
  • Please . This includes the criteria that will be assessed at application and interview. [click here to access the job pack](https://1625independentpeople.peoplehr.net/Handlers/RichTextEditorImageDownload.ashx?file=/Sm9iJTIwUGFjayUyMC0lMjBBc3lsdW0lMjBhbmQlMjBSZWZ1Z2VlcyUyMEludGVuc2l2ZSUyMFN1cHBvcnQlMjBXb3JrZXIucGRm)

  • Please get in touch with us if a hard copy of the application form would be preferred. We will organise a time for you to collect it from and return it to Kingsley Hall (our main office in Old Market). An online application will then be created for you.
 
Contact us:

title: Project Worker

hours.details: 40 hours per week; earliest start 7am and latest finish 10pm; one weekend on and three weekends off in a four-week period.

description: We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest and are recruiting into our High Support team in a busy but rewarding city centre-based housing project for vulnerable young people. By engaging young people with confidence and passion, you will show you love being around them and working with them. By being empathetic, you will show you truly understand the complex needs of young people. Tapping into your skills of working with a diverse caseload, you will help young people develop and reach their goals and aspirations. By working well in a fast-paced environment, you will successfully juggle the demands of a busy caseload and providing on-going support for young people. Ensuring the safety, security, and wellbeing of young people, yourself, and colleagues. By being well organised, efficient, and effective you will support the whole team in a range of housing management functions, including the promotion and facilitation of a positive rent culture. You will participate in the team rolling rota, with earliest start at 7am and latest finish at 10pm, one weekend on and three weekends off in a four-week period. You will be in the High Support Team and your line manager will be the St Georges House Manager. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59 on Monday 19 January 2026. In return for your dedication, we offer a generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays and other benefits. Applicants will be required to pass a DBS check.
responsibilities: Engage young people with confidence and passion to show you love being around them and working with them.
Demonstrate empathy to understand the complex needs of young people.
Utilise skills of working with a diverse caseload to help young people develop and reach their goals and aspirations.
Juggle the demands of a busy caseload and provide ongoing support for young people in a fast-paced environment.
Ensure the safety, security, and wellbeing of young people, yourself, and colleagues.
Support the team in housing management functions, including promotion and facilitation of a positive rent culture.
requirements: Excellent support and housing management skills and experience.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Willingness to work a rotating rota including early starts (as early as 7am) and late finishes (up to 10pm).
Ability to engage with and support vulnerable young people; understanding of complex needs.
benefits: A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays.
Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF.
Supportive and approachable team with emphasis on colleague wellbeing.

title: Heritage Project Trainee - Education, Employment and Training Programme
description:
Heritage Project Trainee - Education, Employment and Training Programme

We are excited to be recruiting for a trainee to join our Heritage team.

Thanks to the National Lottery Heritage Fund we are transforming Kingsley Hall - our charity’s base and Grade 2* listed building - into a welcoming space that will provide training, support and housing for young people who have been homeless, at risk of homelessness or are leaving care. We are also delivering a 5-year Activity Programme which explores the history of the building and relevant themes, through creative heritage projects and an Education, Employment and Training, and Volunteer programme providing skills, knowledge and experience linked to the heritage sector. As part of this exciting project, we are pleased to offer a 6-month trainee role, with a focus on supporting the development of our Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme. NB We will close applications for this opportunity when we have received sufficient applications, as these posts have previously been very popular. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritized ethnic groups, and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. # [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Heritage Project Trainee - Education, Employment and Training Programme
 
We are excited to be recruiting for a trainee to join our Heritage team.
 
​
 
Thanks to the National Lottery Heritage Fund we are transforming Kingsley Hall - our charity’s base and Grade 2* listed building - into a welcoming space that will provide training, support and housing for young people who have been homeless, at risk of homelessness or are leaving care. We are also delivering a 5-year Activity Programme which explores the history of the building and relevant themes, through creative heritage projects and an Education, Employment and Training, and Volunteer programme providing skills, knowledge and experience linked to the heritage sector. As part of this exciting project, we are pleased to offer a 6-month trainee role, with a focus on supporting the development of our Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme. NB We will close applications for this opportunity when we have received sufficient applications, as these posts have previously been very popular. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritized ethnic groups, and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. description: Supported Lodgings Host - South Gloucestershire. Supported Lodgings is a project run by 1625 Independent People in South Gloucestershire. We are looking for host families for 16-25 year olds who are studying or working and who need somewhere to stay before moving into independent living. As a host family, you would provide a bedroom for 6-24 months and help the young person gain the skills they need to move into independent living. You would provide a room in your house for the young person and remain part of a support network with social workers or personal advisors involved. You will receive full training to become a host and be supported by the Supported Lodgings Coordinator. Costs are covered with a £175 per week payment for every week there is a young person in your property. To apply, fill out the application form and email it to supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk. You can also apply via our Volunteering webpage and contact Duncan for an informal chat.

Be part of a supported lodgings program with ongoing support from social workers or personal advisors
Receive training to become a host and ongoing support from the Supported Lodgings Coordinator
Receive £175 per week payment for every week a young person is in your property
requirements: In education, employment or training

Empathetic and able to support young people; DBS check required
