raw_text:
# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Supported Lodgings Host - South Gloucestershire
 
Supported Lodgings is a fantastic next step for young people who are nearly ready to live fully independently but need a helping hand first.  When someone offers a young person a room, it provides a supportive home environment in which they can learn and grow. Leaving care or a service can be difficult and disorientating – we believe when our young people know what it feels like to belong and be valued, they have the stability to thrive. As a host family, you would play a huge part in supporting a young person to feel valued by providing them with a bedroom for 6-24 months and helping them to feel a part of your household whilst they gain the skills they need to move into their own accommodation. We are looking for people across South Gloucestershire, who have a spare bedroom, to become host families for 16-25 year olds who are studying or working and who need somewhere to stay before moving into independent living. What is Supported Lodgings? The Young Person:
 
  • Aged 16-25 years old
  • They are in education, employment or training
  • Low support needs but may need help learning soft skills like cooking, budgeting, cleaning and shopping
  • Need compassion and understanding – they have been on a long journey!
 
The Host:
 
  • We encourage a variety of people to apply
  • We love hosts who are kind and have a passion for young people ​
  • You can provide a room in your house to be the young person's bedroom
  • You are not the young person’s only support, we will continue to provide support and social workers, or personal advisors remain involved
  • You will receive full training to become a host and be supported by our Supported Lodgings Coordinator on every step of your journey
  • Supported Lodgings is a great first step for people who are considering becoming foster carers. We have supported several hosts to make the move into fostering with relevant training and references
  • Costs are covered with a £175 per week payment for every week there is a young person in your property
 
Supported Lodgings is project run by 1625 Independent People in South Gloucestershire. We support young people across the region to reboot their lives and move to independence. . To apply for this role, please fill out this application form, and email it to . Who we are How to Apply: [Please click here to download the application form for this role](https://1625independentpeople.peoplehr.net/Handlers/RichTextEditorImageDownload.ashx?file=/Supported%20Lodgings%20Host%20Application%20Form.docx) [supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk)
 
Alternatively, you can apply on our Volunteering webpage, . If you want to know more, please . The website also has  more info about what hosting is like and what we expect from our hosts and young people.  Alternatively please email Duncan, our Supported Lodgings Coordinator for an informal chat: . [here](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/) [visit our website to apply directly](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/) [supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/)
 
​
 
We believe those with a criminal record should have an equal chance to become employees or volunteers and encourage applications. As an organisation who safeguard and promote the safety and welfare of children, young people and adults at risk, any job offer will depend on a satisfactory DBS (Disclosure and Barring Service) check. We comply fully with the DBS code of practice and undertake to treat all applications for positions fairly. For successful candidates with a criminal record, a risk assessment process will take place with the recruiting manager. We also pride ourselves on being an equal opportunities employer for everyone regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, religion and beliefs, sex and sexual orientation. Please see our section on the website, for further information. Equal opportunities for everyone [Policies](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/policies/)

This is your chance to make a positive difference to the lives of some of the most vulnerable young people in our society. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritised ethnic groups, Muslim and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59, Monday 05 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing:
responsibilities: By developing individual support plans that promote the development of independent living skills including accommodation, EET and wellbeing, you will provide support to young Asylum Seekers to ensure they successfully integrate into the local community and access the services to which they are entitled.

Using your communication and cooperation skills, work with other involved professionals to support young Asylum Seekers through the process of seeking leave to remain in the UK

raw_text:
# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Asylum & Refugees Intensive Support Worker
 
We are excited to be recruiting an Asylum and Refugees Intensive Support worker to work alongside this established team within 1625 Independent People.  As a member of the Asylum & Refugee Team, you will have the opportunity to support young asylum seekers settle into life in the UK. This is your chance to make a positive difference to the lives of some of the most vulnerable young people in our society. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritised ethnic groups, Muslim and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59, Monday 05 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing:
 
  • By developing individual support plans that promote the development of independent living skills including accommodation, EET and wellbeing, you will provide support to young Asylum Seekers to ensure they successfully integrate into the local community and access the services to which they are entitled.
  • Using your problem-solving skills, you will explore proactively move-on options with young people as you support them toward accessing and sustaining suitable alternative accommodation.
  • Using your communication and cooperation skills, work with other involved professionals to support young Asylum Seekers through the process of seeking leave to remain in the UK
  • By being well organised, efficient, and effective you will undertake a host of housing. management tasks including preparing properties for letting, and health and safety checks to ensure the safety of young people, colleagues, and properties.
 
You will be in the Asylum & Refugees Intensive Support team based within the wider South Gloucestershire team and your line manager will be the Asylum and Refugees (Intensive Support) Team Leader. At 1625ip we are led by our Competency Development Framework. This connects our values to our behaviours in everything we do and gives us the tools to develop. The framework ensures our recruitment is better informed, applications and interviews are behaviourally based, and job profiles are developed on the ‘how’ of a job. If you have transferrable skills and you are interested in this role, but you are worried about the application process, please get in touch with us. We encourage you to have an informal chat with the recruiting manager to discuss how your personal or professional experience and skills could be transferred to this role. Details of how you can do that are further down in this advert. Contract details:
 
  • 22.5 hours per week (this represents a 0.6 full time equivalent (FTE) role) Hours per week:
  • Permanent Contract type:
  • £31,537 - £33,143 (pro rata based on 0.6 FTE) Pay:
  • Based in 1625ip’s office in Old Market, Bristol or in Patchway, South Gloucestershire, with an ability to work from other locations in Bristol and occasionally from home. This role will entail travel across Bristol and South Glos so being a driver with access to a vehicle is essential. The location:
 
In return for your dedication, we offer: A few benefits at 1625ip
 
  • A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays
  • Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF
  • A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing:
  • “I feel grateful to work here every day! The work feels useful and worthwhile, and I feel like I am able to make a difference for our young people” (From Colleague Wellbeing Survey 2023).
  • “I couldn’t be happier with the opportunities and support I have received in my career progression that has led me to my dream job!” See what other colleagues have said about their career development with us, . [here](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/about-us/work-with-us/)
  • 1625ip is a Disability Confident Employer.
 
Important dates:
 
  • Application deadline closes: . 23:59, Monday 05 January 2026
  • If you have not heard from us by the end of the day on , please assume that your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion. Thursday 08 January 2026
  • Interviews are on . Thursday 15 January 2026
 
Ready to see yourself in this rewarding role? We can’t wait to hear from you. Application information
 
  • Please . This includes the criteria that will be assessed at application and interview. [click here to access the job pack](https://1625independentpeople.peoplehr.net/Handlers/RichTextEditorImageDownload.ashx?file=/Sm9iJTIwUGFjayUyMC0lMjBBc3lsdW0lMjBhbmQlMjBSZWZ1Z2VlcyUyMEludGVuc2l2ZSUyMFN1cHBvcnQlMjBXb3JrZXIucGRm)
  • ​Please . [click here to download the application form](https://1625independentpeople.peoplehr.net/Handlers/RichTextEditorImageDownload.ashx?file=/UmVjcnVpdG1lbnQlMjBBcHBsaWNhdGlvbiUyMEZvcm0lMjBQSFIlMjAtJTIwQVIlMjBJU1clMjAtJTIwRGVjJTIwMjUuZG9jeA==)
  • You will be asked to answer 5 amount questions at the start of the Word application form. These are required to ensure your application can be shortlisted.
  • Please note the online e-application form cannot be saved so we recommend you prepare your Word application form before you start filling in the e-form.
  • Please get in touch with us if a hard copy of the application form would be preferred. We will organise a time for you to collect it from and return it to Kingsley Hall (our main office in Old Market). An online application will then be created for you.
 
Contact us:
 
  • To have an informal chat about the role, please contact or [jeremy.wide@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:jeremy.wide@1625ip.co.uk) [karen.clark@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:karen.clark@1625ip.co.uk)
  • If you have any queries, please email [jobs@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:jobs@1625ip.co.uk)
  • For support with your application, skills, training and your career ’s dedicated advisors who can assist you. [Skills Connect](https://www.skillsconnect.org.uk/contact-us/speak-to-us/)
 
We believe those with a criminal record should have an equal chance to become employees or volunteers and encourage applications. As an organisation who safeguard and promote the safety and welfare of children, young people and adults at risk, any job offer will depend on a satisfactory DBS (Disclosure and Barring Service) check. Successful candidates will need to provide our organisation with sufficient documentation to prove ID. We comply fully with the DBS code of practice and undertake to treat all applications for positions fairly. For successful candidates with a criminal record, a risk assessment process will take place with the recruiting manager. We also pride ourselves on being an equitable opportunities employer for everyone regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, religion and beliefs, sex and sexual orientation. title: Heritage Project Trainee - Education, Employment and Training Programme

hours.details: 60% of full-time role (3 days per week)

description: Heritage Project Trainee - Education, Employment and Training Programme We are excited to be recruiting for a trainee to join our Heritage team. Thanks to the National Lottery Heritage Fund we are transforming Kingsley Hall - our charity’s base and Grade 2* listed building - into a welcoming space that will provide training, support and housing for young people who have been homeless, at risk of homelessness or are leaving care. We are also delivering a 5-year Activity Programme which explores the history of the building and relevant themes, through creative heritage projects and an Education, Employment and Training, and Volunteer programme providing skills, knowledge and experience linked to the heritage sector. As part of this exciting project, we are pleased to offer a 6-month trainee role, with a focus on supporting the development of our Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme. NB We will close applications for this opportunity when we have received sufficient applications, as these posts have previously been very popular. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritized ethnic groups, and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59 on 22 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing:
responsibilities: Using your ability to connect with what Young People might need or want, and empathetic communication you will be supporting the development of the Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme to create more opportunities for Young People.
Being proactive and with a positive, confident approach to reaching out to contacts, you will network with the heritage craft, trade and maintenance industries.

Enjoying learning from others and undertaking detailed research about what’s already out there, you will liaise with colleges and training programmes and develop professional communication skills. For example, you might integrate the Historic England skills builders into our offer.
Widening project planning skills, and an attention to detail, risk management and tailoring opportunities you will set up tasters, trips and work experience opportunities for Young People.
Working alongside your team and being a positive presence in the room, you will support the training of employers and providers.

You will have the opportunity to develop creative skills and combine this with an approach to inclusivity and accessibility. You will have the chance to take responsibility for the creation of Education, Employment and Training resources and content for Young People.
benefits: A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays
Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF
A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing
1625 Independent People is a Disability Confident Employer.
company_info: 1625 Independent People
how_to_apply: Please see the advert for details on how to apply. This includes the criteria that will be assessed at application and interview. Contact Grace Swordy at grace.swordy@1625ip.co.uk or jobs@1625ip.co.uk for queries. You will also find links to download the job pack and application form within the advert. If you need an informal chat, you can reach out to the recruiting manager.

# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Heritage Project Trainee - Education, Employment and Training Programme
 
We are excited to be recruiting for a trainee to join our Heritage team.
 
​
 
Thanks to the National Lottery Heritage Fund we are transforming Kingsley Hall - our charity’s base and Grade 2* listed building - into a welcoming space that will provide training, support and housing for young people who have been homeless, at risk of homelessness or are leaving care. We are also delivering a 5-year Activity Programme which explores the history of the building and relevant themes, through creative heritage projects and an Education, Employment and Training, and Volunteer programme providing skills, knowledge and experience linked to the heritage sector. As part of this exciting project, we are pleased to offer a 6-month trainee role, with a focus on supporting the development of our Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme. NB We will close applications for this opportunity when we have received sufficient applications, as these posts have previously been very popular. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritized ethnic groups, and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59 on 22 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing:
 
  • Using your ability to connect with what Young People might need or want, and empathetic communication you will be supporting the development of the Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme to create more opportunities for Young People.
  • Being proactive and with a positive, confident approach to reaching out to contacts, you will network with the heritage craft, trade and maintenance industries.
  • Enjoying learning from others and undertaking detailed research about what’s already out there, you will liaise with colleges and training programmes and develop professional communication skills. For example, you might integrate the Historic England skills builders into our offer.
  • Widening project planning skills, and an attention to detail, risk management and tailoring opportunities you will set up tasters, trips and work experience opportunities for Young People.
  • Working alongside your team and being a positive presence in the room, you will support the training of employers and providers.
  • You will have the opportunity to develop creative skills and combine this with an approach to inclusivity and accessibility. You will have the chance to take responsibility for the creation of Education, Employment and Training resources and content for Young People.
 
You will be in the Heritage Team, which sits within our Routes Team and your manager will be The Senior Heritage Activities Co-ordinator. At 1625ip we are led by our Competency Development Framework. This connects our values to our behaviours in everything we do and gives us the tools to develop. The framework ensures our recruitment is better informed, applications and interviews are behaviourally based and job profiles are developed on the ‘how’ of a job. No prior experience? No problem! We believe in your potential and are committed to providing training and support to help you thrive. If you have transferrable skills, relevant lived experience or a willingness to learn, and you are interested in this role but you are worried about the application process, please get in touch with us. We encourage you to have an informal chat with the recruiting manager to discuss how your personal or professional experience and skills could be transferred to this role. # [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Project and Student Support Officer - Youth Education Service
 
We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritized ethnic groups, Muslim, and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. At 1625ip our work is rooted in Psychologically Informed Environments (PIE) and Trauma-Informed Practice (TIP). Our Psychologically Informed Framework shapes how we build relationships, use our spaces, and support young people. This means we prioritise safety, trust, collaboration, and understanding the impact of trauma in every interaction. You don’t need prior experience in PIE or TIP to apply - we’ll support you to learn and develop these approaches in the role. We are excited to be recruiting into our Youth Education Service (YES). The Project Support Officer is a key role for our small functional skills provision. This is a varied role, and duties include day-to-day tasks to ensure the smooth running of our learning centre, database administration and providing crucial support during busy exam periods. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59, 16 January 2026. Who are we? How we work What you will be doing:
 
  • Providing general administrative support to our YES Manager and a small team of YES Tutors.
  • General tasks to ensure the smooth running of the YES centre such as Health and Safety checks and ordering stationery.
  • Data entry and processing to support student related administration, invoicing and internal and external reporting
  • Administrative tasks to support during exam periods
 
You will be in the YES team, and your line manager will be our YES Manager.
 
Our Competency Development Framework sits at the heart of how we work at 1625ip. It links our values with the behaviours we expect to see in everyday practice and supports colleagues to learn, reflect and develop. It also means our recruitment is grounded in behaviours, not just experience, so applications, interviews and job profiles all focus on how we work, not only what we do. If you have transferrable skills and you are interested in this role, but you are worried about the application process, please get in touch with us. We encourage you to have an informal chat with the recruiting manager to discuss how your personal or professional experience and skills could be transferred to this role. In return for your dedication, we offer: A few benefits at 1625ip

  • Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF.
  • Regular training and development opportunities
  • A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing.
  • “1625 Independent People is an amazing organisation, and I feel very lucky to work here”, Colleague Wellbeing Survey 2024.

raw_text:
# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Supported Lodgings Host - South Gloucestershire
 
Supported Lodgings is a fantastic next step for young people who are nearly ready to live fully independently but need a helping hand first.  When someone offers a young person a room, it provides a supportive home environment in which they can learn and grow. Leaving care or a service can be difficult and disorientating – we believe when our young people know what it feels like to belong and be valued, they have the stability to thrive. As a host family, you would play a huge part in supporting a young person to feel valued by providing them with a bedroom for 6-24 months and helping them to feel a part of your household whilst they gain the skills they need to move into their own accommodation. We are looking for people across South Gloucestershire, who have a spare bedroom, to become host families for 16-25 year olds who are studying or working and who need somewhere to stay before moving into independent living. What is Supported Lodgings? The Young Person:
 
  • Aged 16-25 years old
  • They are in education, employment or training
  • Low support needs but may need help learning soft skills like cooking, budgeting, cleaning and shopping
  • Need compassion and understanding – they have been on a long journey!
 
The Host:
 
  • We encourage a variety of people to apply
  • We love hosts who are kind and have a passion for young people ​
  • You can provide a room in your house to be the young person's bedroom
  • You are not the young person’s only support, we will continue to provide support and social workers, or personal advisors remain involved
  • You will receive full training to become a host and be supported by our Supported Lodgings Coordinator on every step of your journey
  • Supported Lodgings is a great first step for people who are considering becoming foster carers. We have supported several hosts to make the move into fostering with relevant training and references
  • Costs are covered with a £175 per week payment for every week there is a young person in your property
 
Supported Lodgings is project run by 1625 Independent People in South Gloucestershire. We support young people across the region to reboot their lives and move to independence. . To apply for this role, please fill out this application form, and email it to . Who we are How to Apply: [Please click here to download the application form for this role](https://1625independentpeople.peoplehr.net/Handlers/RichTextEditorImageDownload.ashx?file=/Supported%20Lodgings%20Host%20Application%20Form.docx) [supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk)
 
Alternatively, you can apply on our Volunteering webpage, . If you want to know more, please . The website also has  more info about what hosting is like and what we expect from our hosts and young people.  Alternatively please email Duncan, our Supported Lodgings Coordinator for an informal chat: . [here](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/) [visit our website to apply directly](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/) [supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/)
 
​

As an organisation who safeguard and promote the safety and welfare of children, young people and adults at risk, any job offer will depend on a satisfactory DBS (Disclosure and Barring Service) check. We comply fully with the DBS code of practice and undertake to treat all applications for positions fairly. For successful candidates with a criminal record, a risk assessment process will take place with the recruiting manager. We also pride ourselves on being an equal opportunities employer for everyone regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, religion and beliefs, sex and sexual orientation. Please see our section on the website, for further information. Equal opportunities for everyone [Policies](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/policies/)

# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Asylum & Refugees Intensive Support Worker
 
We are excited to be recruiting an Asylum and Refugees Intensive Support worker to work alongside this established team within 1625 Independent People.  As a member of the Asylum & Refugee Team, you will have the opportunity to support young asylum seekers settle into life in the UK. This is your chance to make a positive difference to the lives of some of the most vulnerable young people in our society. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritised ethnic groups, Muslim and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59, Monday 05 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing:
 
  • By developing individual support plans that promote the development of independent living skills including accommodation, EET and wellbeing, you will provide support to young Asylum Seekers to ensure they successfully integrate into the local community and access the services to which they are entitled.
  • Using your problem-solving skills, you will explore proactively move-on options with young people as you support them toward accessing and sustaining suitable alternative accommodation.
  • Using your communication and cooperation skills, work with other involved professionals to support young Asylum Seekers through the process of seeking leave to remain in the UK
  • By being well organised, efficient, and effective you will undertake a host of housing. management tasks including preparing properties for letting, and health and safety checks to ensure the safety of young people, colleagues, and properties.
 
You will be in the Asylum & Refugees Intensive Support team based within the wider South Gloucestershire team and your line manager will be the Asylum and Refugees (Intensive Support) Team Leader. At 1625ip we are led by our Competency Development Framework. This connects our values to our behaviours in everything we do and gives us the tools to develop. The framework ensures our recruitment is better informed, applications and interviews are behaviourally based, and job profiles are developed on the ‘how’ of a job. If you have transferrable skills and you are interested in this role, but you are worried about the application process, please get in touch with us. We encourage you to have an informal chat with the recruiting manager to discuss how your personal or professional experience and skills could be transferred to this role. # [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Project Worker
 
We are striving to better represent the young people we support and are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritised ethnic groups, male candidates, and people with relevant lived experience, as these groups are currently under-represented in our organisation. For this role, being male and/or Black/Black British has been identified as a genuine occupational requirement under Schedule 9, Paragraph 1 of the Equality Act 2010. We will therefore prioritise applicants who meet this requirement, while still welcoming applications from all suitably qualified candidates. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. We are excited to be recruiting into our High Support team in a busy but rewarding city centre-based housing project for vulnerable young people. If you have a desire to help young people and have excellent support and housing management skills and experience, we want to hear from you. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is at 23:59 on Monday 19 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing:
 
  • By engaging young people with confidence and passion, you will show you love being around them and working with them.
  • By being empathetic, you will show you truly understand the complex needs of young people.
  • Tapping into your skills of working with a diverse caseload, you will help young people develop and reach their goals and aspirations.
  • By working well in a fast-paced environment, you will successfully juggle the demands of a busy caseload and providing on-going support for young people.
  • Ensuring the safety, security, and wellbeing of young people, yourself, and colleagues.
  • By being well organised, efficient, and effective you will support the whole team in a range of housing management functions, including the promotion and facilitation of a positive rent culture.
 
You will participate in the team rolling rota, with earliest start at 7am and latest finish at 10pm, one weekend on and three weekends off in a four-week period. You will be in the High Support Team and your line manager will be the St Georges House Manager.
 
At 1625ip we are led by our Competency Development Framework. This connects our values to our behaviours in everything we do and gives us the tools to develop. The framework ensures our recruitment is better informed, applications and interviews are behaviourally based, and job profiles are developed on the ‘how’ of a job. If you have transferrable skills and you are interested in this role, but you are worried about the application process, please get in touch with us. We encourage you to have an informal chat with the recruiting manager to discuss how your personal or professional experience and skills could be transferred to this role. Details of how you can do that are further down in this advert. Contract details
 
  • 40 (this represents full time hours) Hours per week:
  • Permanent. Contract type:
  • £28,142 - £29,540 (starting at the bottom of the scale) Pay:
  • You will be based in St George’s House, close to Bristol’s main bus station as well as the vibrant city centre. The location:
 
In return for your dedication, we offer: A few benefits at 1625ip
 
  • A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays
  • Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF
  • A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing
  • “1625 Independent People is an amazing organisation, and I feel very lucky to work here”, Colleague Wellbeing Survey 2024.
  • “I couldn’t be happier with the opportunities and support I have received in my career progression that has led me to my dream job!” See what other colleagues have said about their career development with us, on the . [vacancy page of our website](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/about-us/work-with-us/)
 
Important dates
 
  • Application deadline closes: . 23:59 Monday 19 January 2026
  • If you have not heard from us by the end of the day on please assume that your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion. Wednesday 21 January 2026
  • Interviews are on . Wednesday 28 January 2026
 
​
 
Ready to see yourself in this rewarding role? We can’t wait to hear from you. Application information
 
  • . This includes the criteria that will be assessed at application and interview. [Please click here to access the job pack](https://1625independentpeople.peoplehr.net/Handlers/RichTextEditorImageDownload.ashx?file=/Sm9iJTIwUGFjayUyMC0lMjBQcm9qZWN0JTIwV29ya2VyJTIwKFN0JTIwR2VvcmdlcyUyMEhvdXNlKSUyMC0lMjBEZWMlMjAyMDI1LnBkZg==)

Contact us

description: Heritage Project Trainee - Education, Employment and Training Programme. We are excited to be recruiting for a trainee to join our Heritage team. Thanks to the National Lottery Heritage Fund we are transforming Kingsley Hall - our charity’s base and Grade 2* listed building - into a welcoming space that will provide training, support and housing for young people who have been homeless, at risk of homelessness or are leaving care. We are also delivering a 5-year Activity Programme which explores the history of the building and relevant themes, through creative heritage projects and an Education, Employment and Training, and Volunteer programme providing skills, knowledge and experience linked to the heritage sector. As part of this exciting project, we are pleased to offer a 6-month trainee role, with a focus on supporting the development of our Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme. NB We will close applications for this opportunity when we have received sufficient applications, as these posts have previously been very popular. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritized ethnic groups, and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. Contract details: 22.5 (60%) Hours per week; Fixed Term for 6 months; Salary £24,294 per annum pro rata; Location: Kingsley Hall, central Bristol. In return for your dedication, we offer: A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays; Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF; A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing. 1625ip is a Disability Confident Employer. Important dates and application information are provided in the advert and on our website.
responsibilities: Using your ability to connect with what Young People might need or want, and empathetic communication you will be supporting the development of the Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme to create more opportunities for Young People.
Being proactive and with a positive, confident approach to reaching out to contacts, you will network with the heritage craft, trade and maintenance industries.

Enjoying learning from others and undertaking detailed research about what’s already out there, you will liaise with colleges and training programmes and develop professional communication skills. For example, you might integrate the Historic England skills builders into our offer.
Widening project planning skills, and an attention to detail, risk management and tailoring opportunities you will set up tasters, trips and work experience opportunities for Young People.
Working alongside your team and being a positive presence in the room, you will support the training of employers and providers.

You will have the opportunity to develop creative skills and combine this with an approach to inclusivity and accessibility. You will have the chance to take responsibility for the creation of Education, Employment and Training resources and content for Young People.
benefits: A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays
Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF
A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing
1625ip is a Disability Confident Employer

# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Heritage Project Trainee - Education, Employment and Training Programme
 
We are excited to be recruiting for a trainee to join our Heritage team.
 
​
 
Thanks to the National Lottery Heritage Fund we are transforming Kingsley Hall - our charity’s base and Grade 2* listed building - into a welcoming space that will provide training, support and housing for young people who have been homeless, at risk of homelessness or are leaving care. We are also delivering a 5-year Activity Programme which explores the history of the building and relevant themes, through creative heritage projects and an Education, Employment and Training, and Volunteer programme providing skills, knowledge and experience linked to the heritage sector. As part of this exciting project, we are pleased to offer a 6-month trainee role, with a focus on supporting the development of our Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme. NB We will close applications for this opportunity when we have received sufficient applications, as these posts have previously been very popular. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritized ethnic groups, and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59 on 22 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing:
 
  • Using your ability to connect with what Young People might need or want, and empathetic communication you will be supporting the development of the Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme to create more opportunities for Young People.
  • Being proactive and with a positive, confident approach to reaching out to contacts, you will network with the heritage craft, trade and maintenance industries.
  • Enjoying learning from others and undertaking detailed research about what’s already out there, you will liaise with colleges and training programmes and develop professional communication skills. For example, you might integrate the Historic England skills builders into our offer.
  • Widening project planning skills, and an attention to detail, risk management and tailoring opportunities you will set up tasters, trips and work experience opportunities for Young People.
  • Working alongside your team and being a positive presence in the room, you will support the training of employers and providers.
  • You will have the opportunity to develop creative skills and combine this with an approach to inclusivity and accessibility. You will have the chance to take responsibility for the creation of Education, Employment and Training resources and content for Young People.
 
You will be in the Heritage Team, which sits within our Routes Team and your manager will be The Senior Heritage Activities Co-ordinator. At 1625ip we are led by our Competency Development Framework. This connects our values to our behaviours in everything we do and gives us the tools to develop. The framework ensures our recruitment is better informed, applications and interviews are behaviourally based and job profiles are developed on the ‘how’ of a job. No prior experience? No problem! We believe in your potential and are committed to providing training and support to help you thrive. If you have transferrable skills, relevant lived experience or a willingness to learn, and you are interested in this role but you are worried about the application process, please get in touch with us. We encourage you to have an informal chat with the recruiting manager to discuss how your personal or professional experience and skills could be transferred to this role. Details of how you can do that are further down in this advert. Contract details
 
  • 22.5 (this represents 60% of a full-time role = 3 days a week) Hours per week:
  • Fixed Term for 6 months Contract type:
  • £24,294 per annum (£14,576.40 pro rata) Pay:
  • You will be based in central Bristol, close to Bristol’s main train and bus stations as well as the vibrant city centre. The location:
 
In return for your dedication, we offer: A few benefits at 1625ip
 
  • A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays
  • Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF
  • A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing
  • “1625 Independent People is an amazing organisation and I feel very lucky to work here”, Colleague Wellbeing Survey 2024.
  • “I couldn’t be happier with the opportunities and support I have received in my career progression that has led me to my dream job!” See what other colleagues have said about their career development with us, on the . [vacancy page of our website](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/about-us/work-with-us/)
  • 1625ip is a Disability Confident Employer.
 
Important dates
 
  • Application deadline closes: or before if we have received sufficient applications. 23:59 on Thursday 22 January 2026
  • f you have not heard from us by the end of the day on , please assume that your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion. I Monday 02 February 2025
  • Interviews are on . Monday 09 February 2026
 
Ready to see yourself in this rewarding role? We can’t wait to hear from you. Application information

title: Project and Student Support Officer - Youth Education Service
description: We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritized ethnic groups, Muslim, and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. At 1625ip our work is rooted in Psychologically Informed Environments (PIE) and Trauma-Informed Practice (TIP). Our Psychologically Informed Framework shapes how we build relationships, use our spaces, and support young people. This means we prioritise safety, trust, collaboration, and understanding the impact of trauma in every interaction. You don’t need prior experience in PIE or TIP to apply - we’ll support you to learn and develop these approaches in the role. We are excited to be recruiting into our Youth Education Service (YES). The Project Support Officer is a key role for our small functional skills provision. This is a varied role, and duties include day-to-day tasks to ensure the smooth running of our learning centre, database administration and providing crucial support during busy exam periods. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59, 16 January 2026. Who are we? How we work What you will be doing: • Providing general administrative support to our YES Manager and a small team of YES Tutors. • General tasks to ensure the smooth running of the YES centre such as Health and Safety checks and ordering stationery. • Data entry and processing to support student related administration, invoicing and internal and external reporting • Administrative tasks to support during exam periods

General tasks to ensure the smooth running of the YES centre such as Health and Safety checks and ordering stationery.
Data entry and processing to support student related administration, invoicing and internal and external reporting
Administrative tasks to support during exam periods
benefits: A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus Bank Holidays (Pro-rata)
Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF.

# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Project and Student Support Officer - Youth Education Service
 
We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritized ethnic groups, Muslim, and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. At 1625ip our work is rooted in Psychologically Informed Environments (PIE) and Trauma-Informed Practice (TIP). Our Psychologically Informed Framework shapes how we build relationships, use our spaces, and support young people. This means we prioritise safety, trust, collaboration, and understanding the impact of trauma in every interaction. You don’t need prior experience in PIE or TIP to apply - we’ll support you to learn and develop these approaches in the role. We are excited to be recruiting into our Youth Education Service (YES). The Project Support Officer is a key role for our small functional skills provision. This is a varied role, and duties include day-to-day tasks to ensure the smooth running of our learning centre, database administration and providing crucial support during busy exam periods. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59, 16 January 2026. Who are we? How we work What you will be doing:
 
  • Providing general administrative support to our YES Manager and a small team of YES Tutors.
  • General tasks to ensure the smooth running of the YES centre such as Health and Safety checks and ordering stationery.
  • Data entry and processing to support student related administration, invoicing and internal and external reporting
  • Administrative tasks to support during exam periods
 
You will be in the YES team, and your line manager will be our YES Manager.
 
Our Competency Development Framework sits at the heart of how we work at 1625ip. It links our values with the behaviours we expect to see in everyday practice and supports colleagues to learn, reflect and develop. It also means our recruitment is grounded in behaviours, not just experience, so applications, interviews and job profiles all focus on how we work, not only what we do. If you have transferrable skills and you are interested in this role, but you are worried about the application process, please get in touch with us. We encourage you to have an informal chat with the recruiting manager to discuss how your personal or professional experience and skills could be transferred to this role. Details of how you can do that are further down in this advert. Contract details
 
  • 15 hours a week, 2 days (0.4 FTE) Hours per week:
  • Permanent Contract type:
  • £26,824 - £28,142 (NJC scale 8-11 - which will be pro rata based on 0.4 FTE) Pay:
  • Youth Education Service, Hide Market, Bristol. This role is mostly office based, with occasional working from home. The location:
 
​
 
In return for your dedication, we offer: A few benefits at 1625ip
 
  • A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus Bank Holidays (Pro-rata)
  • Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF.
  • Regular training and development opportunities
  • A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing.
  • “1625 Independent People is an amazing organisation, and I feel very lucky to work here”, Colleague Wellbeing Survey 2024.
  • 1625ip is a Disability Confident Employer.
 
​
 
Important dates
 
  • Application deadline closes: 23:59 Friday, 16 January 2026
  • If you have not heard from us by the end of the day on please assume that your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion. Monday, 19 January 2026
  • Interviews are on Friday, 23 January 2026
 
Ready to see yourself in this rewarding role? We can’t wait to hear from you. Application information ​
 
  • Please . This includes the criteria that will be assessed at application and interview. [click here to access the job pack](https://1625independentpeople.peoplehr.net/Handlers/RichTextEditorImageDownload.ashx?file=/Sm9iJTIwUGFjayUyMC0lMjBQU1NPJTIwLSUyMERlYyUyMDI1LnBkZg==)
  • Please . [click here to download the application form](https://1625independentpeople.peoplehr.net/Handlers/RichTextEditorImageDownload.ashx?file=/UmVjcnVpdG1lbnQlMjBBcHBsaWNhdGlvbiUyMEZvcm0lMjBQSFIlMjAtJTIwUFNTTyUyMERlYyUyMDI1LmRvY3g=)
  • You will be asked to answer 5 amount questions at the top of the Word application form. These are required to ensure your application can be shortlisted.
  • Please note the online e-application form cannot be saved so we recommend you prepare your Word application form before you start filling in the e-form.
  • Please get in touch with us if a hard copy of the application form would be preferred. We will organise a time for you to collect it from and return it to Kingsley Hall (our main office in Old Market). An online application will then be created for you.
 
​
 
Contact us
 
  • To have an informal chat about the role, please contact [rebecca.ball@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:rebecca.ball@1625ip.co.uk)
  • If you have any queries, please email [jobs@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:jobs@1625ip.co.uk)

Successful candidates will need to provide our organisation with sufficient documentation to prove ID. We comply fully with the DBS code of practice and undertake to treat all applications for positions fairly. For successful candidates with a criminal record, a risk assessment process will take place with the recruiting manager. We also pride ourselves on being an equitable opportunities employer for everyone regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, religion and beliefs, sex and sexual orientation. raw_text:
# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Supported Lodgings Host - South Gloucestershire
 
Supported Lodgings is a fantastic next step for young people who are nearly ready to live fully independently but need a helping hand first.  When someone offers a young person a room, it provides a supportive home environment in which they can learn and grow. Leaving care or a service can be difficult and disorientating – we believe when our young people know what it feels like to belong and be valued, they have the stability to thrive. As a host family, you would play a huge part in supporting a young person to feel valued by providing them with a bedroom for 6-24 months and helping them to feel a part of your household whilst they gain the skills they need to move into their own accommodation. We are looking for people across South Gloucestershire, who have a spare bedroom, to become host families for 16-25 year olds who are studying or working and who need somewhere to stay before moving into independent living. What is Supported Lodgings? The Young Person:
 
  • Aged 16-25 years old
  • They are in education, employment or training
  • Low support needs but may need help learning soft skills like cooking, budgeting, cleaning and shopping
  • Need compassion and understanding – they have been on a long journey!
 
The Host:
 
  • We encourage a variety of people to apply
  • We love hosts who are kind and have a passion for young people ​
  • You can provide a room in your house to be the young person's bedroom
  • You are not the young person’s only support, we will continue to provide support and social workers, or personal advisors remain involved
  • You will receive full training to become a host and be supported by our Supported Lodgings Coordinator on every step of your journey
  • Supported Lodgings is a great first step for people who are considering becoming foster carers. We have supported several hosts to make the move into fostering with relevant training and references
  • Costs are covered with a £175 per week payment for every week there is a young person in your property
 
Supported Lodgings is project run by 1625 Independent People in South Gloucestershire. We support young people across the region to reboot their lives and move to independence. . To apply for this role, please fill out this application form, and email it to . Who we are How to Apply: [Please click here to download the application form for this role](https://1625independentpeople.peoplehr.net/Handlers/RichTextEditorImageDownload.ashx?file=/Supported%20Lodgings%20Host%20Application%20Form.docx) [supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk)
 
Alternatively, you can apply on our Volunteering webpage, . If you want to know more, please . The website also has  more info about what hosting is like and what we expect from our hosts and young people.  Alternatively please email Duncan, our Supported Lodgings Coordinator for an informal chat: . [here](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/) [visit our website to apply directly](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/) [supportedlodgings@1625ip.co.uk](mailto:https://www.1625ip.co.uk/volunteer/supported-lodgings-in-south-gloucestershire/)
 
​
 
We believe those with a criminal record should have an equal chance to become employees or volunteers and encourage applications. As an organisation who safeguard and promote the safety and welfare of children, young people and adults at risk, any job offer will depend on a satisfactory DBS (Disclosure and Barring Service) check. We comply fully with the DBS code of practice and undertake to treat all applications for positions fairly. For successful candidates with a criminal record, a risk assessment process will take place with the recruiting manager. We also pride ourselves on being an equal opportunities employer for everyone regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, religion and beliefs, sex and sexual orientation. Please see our section on the website, for further information. Equal opportunities for everyone [Policies](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/policies/)

description: We are excited to be recruiting an Asylum and Refugees Intensive Support worker to work alongside this established team within 1625 Independent People. As a member of the Asylum & Refugee Team, you will have the opportunity to support young asylum seekers settle into life in the UK. This is your chance to make a positive difference to the lives of some of the most vulnerable young people in our society. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritised ethnic groups, Muslim and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59, Monday 05 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing: By developing individual support plans that promote the development of independent living skills including accommodation, EET and wellbeing, you will provide support to young Asylum Seekers to ensure they successfully integrate into the local community and access the services to which they are entitled. Using your problem-solving skills, you will explore proactively move-on options with young people as you support them toward accessing and sustaining suitable alternative accommodation. Using your communication and cooperation skills, work with other involved professionals to support young Asylum Seekers through the process of seeking leave to remain in the UK. By being well organised, efficient, and effective you will undertake a host of housing management tasks including preparing properties for letting, and health and safety checks to ensure the safety of young people, colleagues, and properties. You will be in the Asylum & Refugees Intensive Support team based within the wider South Gloucestershire team and your line manager will be the Asylum and Refugees (Intensive Support) Team Leader. At 1625ip we are led by our Competency Development Framework. This connects our values to our behaviours in everything we do and gives us the tools to develop. This role will entail travel across Bristol and South Glos so being a driver with access to a vehicle is essential. In return for your dedication, we offer: A few benefits at 1625ip: A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays; Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF; A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing; I feel grateful to work here every day! The work feels useful and worthwhile, and I feel like I am able to make a difference for our young people; I couldn’t be happier with the opportunities and support I have received in my career progression that has led me to my dream job! See what other colleagues have said about their career development with us; 1625ip is a Disability Confident Employer. Please get in touch with us if a hard copy of the application form would be preferred. We will organise a time for you to collect it from and return it to Kingsley Hall (our main office in Old Market). An online application will then be created for you. We believe those with a criminal record should have an equal chance to become employees or volunteers and encourage applications. Any job offer will depend on a satisfactory DBS check. We are an equitable opportunities employer for everyone regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, religion and beliefs, sex and sexual orientation. description:
We are striving to better represent the young people we support and are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritised ethnic groups, male candidates, and people with relevant lived experience, as these groups are currently under-represented in our organisation. For this role, being male and/or Black/Black British has been identified as a genuine occupational requirement under Schedule 9, Paragraph 1 of the Equality Act 2010. We will therefore prioritise applicants who meet this requirement, while still welcoming applications from all suitably qualified candidates. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. We are excited to be recruiting into our High Support team in a busy but rewarding city centre-based housing project for vulnerable young people. If you have a desire to help young people and have excellent support and housing management skills and experience, we want to hear from you. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is at 23:59 on Monday 19 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing:

• By engaging young people with confidence and passion, you will show you love being around them and working with them.
• By being empathetic, you will show you truly understand the complex needs of young people.
• Tapping into your skills of working with a diverse caseload, you will help young people develop and reach their goals and aspirations.
• By working well in a fast-paced environment, you will successfully juggle the demands of a busy caseload and providing on-going support for young people.
• Ensuring the safety, security, and wellbeing of young people, yourself, and colleagues.
• By being well organised, efficient, and effective you will support the whole team in a range of housing management functions, including the promotion and facilitation of a positive rent culture.

You will participate in the team rolling rota, with earliest start at 7am and latest finish at 10pm, one weekend on and three weekends off in a four-week period. You will be in the High Support Team and your line manager will be the St Georges House Manager.

At 1625ip we are led by our Competency Development Framework. This connects our values to our behaviours in everything we do and gives us the tools to develop. The framework ensures our recruitment is better informed, applications and interviews are behaviourally based, and job profiles are developed on the ‘how’ of a job. If you have transferrable skills and you are interested in this role, but you are worried about the application process, please get in touch with us. We encourage you to have an informal chat with the recruiting manager to discuss how your personal or professional experience and skills could be transferred to this role. Details of how you can do that are further down in this advert. Contract details

• 40 (this represents full time hours) Hours per week:
• Permanent. Contract type:
• £28,142 - £29,540 (starting at the bottom of the scale) Pay:
• You will be based in St George’s House, close to Bristol’s main bus station as well as the vibrant city centre. The location:

In return for your dedication, we offer: A few benefits at 1625ip

• A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays
• Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF
• A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing
• “1625 Independent People is an amazing organisation, and I feel very lucky to work here”, Colleague Wellbeing Survey 2024.
• “I couldn’t be happier with the opportunities and support I have received in my career progression that has led me to my dream job!” See what other colleagues have said about their career development with us, on the vacancy page of our website

Important dates

• Application deadline closes: 23:59 Monday 19 January 2026
• If you have not heard from us by the end of the day on please assume that your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion. Wednesday 21 January 2026
• Interviews are on Wednesday 28 January 2026

description: Heritage Project Trainee - Education, Employment and Training Programme. We are excited to be recruiting for a trainee to join our Heritage team. Thanks to the National Lottery Heritage Fund we are transforming Kingsley Hall - our charity's base and Grade 2* listed building - into a welcoming space that will provide training, support and housing for young people who have been homeless, at risk of homelessness or are leaving care. We are also delivering a 5-year Activity Programme which explores the history of the building and relevant themes, through creative heritage projects and an Education, Employment and Training, and Volunteer programme providing skills, knowledge and experience linked to the heritage sector. As part of this exciting project, we are pleased to offer a 6-month trainee role, with a focus on supporting the development of our Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme.
responsibilities: Using your ability to connect with what Young People might need or want, and empathetic communication you will be supporting the development of the Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme to create more opportunities for Young People.
Being proactive and with a positive, confident approach to reaching out to contacts, you will network with the heritage craft, trade and maintenance industries.

Enjoying learning from others and undertaking detailed research about what’s already out there, you will liaise with colleges and training programmes and develop professional communication skills. For example, you might integrate the Historic England skills builders into our offer.
Widening project planning skills, and an attention to detail, risk management and tailoring opportunities you will set up tasters, trips and work experience opportunities for Young People.
Working alongside your team and being a positive presence in the room, you will support the training of employers and providers.

You will have the opportunity to develop creative skills and combine this with an approach to inclusivity and accessibility. You will have the chance to take responsibility for the creation of Education, Employment and Training resources and content for Young People.

If you have transferable skills, relevant lived experience or a willingness to learn, and you are interested in this role but you are worried about the application process, please get in touch with us.

# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Heritage Project Trainee - Education, Employment and Training Programme
 
We are excited to be recruiting for a trainee to join our Heritage team.
 
​
 
Thanks to the National Lottery Heritage Fund we are transforming Kingsley Hall - our charity’s base and Grade 2* listed building - into a welcoming space that will provide training, support and housing for young people who have been homeless, at risk of homelessness or are leaving care. We are also delivering a 5-year Activity Programme which explores the history of the building and relevant themes, through creative heritage projects and an Education, Employment and Training, and Volunteer programme providing skills, knowledge and experience linked to the heritage sector. As part of this exciting project, we are pleased to offer a 6-month trainee role, with a focus on supporting the development of our Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme. NB We will close applications for this opportunity when we have received sufficient applications, as these posts have previously been very popular. We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritized ethnic groups, and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. Please find full details of how to apply via our website in the advert below. The deadline for application submissions is 23:59 on 22 January 2026. Who are we? What you will be doing:
 
  • Using your ability to connect with what Young People might need or want, and empathetic communication you will be supporting the development of the Heritage Education, Employment and Training programme to create more opportunities for Young People.
  • Being proactive and with a positive, confident approach to reaching out to contacts, you will network with the heritage craft, trade and maintenance industries.
  • Enjoying learning from others and undertaking detailed research about what’s already out there, you will liaise with colleges and training programmes and develop professional communication skills. For example, you might integrate the Historic England skills builders into our offer.
  • Widening project planning skills, and an attention to detail, risk management and tailoring opportunities you will set up tasters, trips and work experience opportunities for Young People.
  • Working alongside your team and being a positive presence in the room, you will support the training of employers and providers.
  • You will have the opportunity to develop creative skills and combine this with an approach to inclusivity and accessibility. You will have the chance to take responsibility for the creation of Education, Employment and Training resources and content for Young People.
 
You will be in the Heritage Team, which sits within our Routes Team and your manager will be The Senior Heritage Activities Co-ordinator. At 1625ip we are led by our Competency Development Framework. This connects our values to our behaviours in everything we do and gives us the tools to develop. The framework ensures our recruitment is better informed, applications and interviews are behaviourally based and job profiles are developed on the ‘how’ of a job. No prior experience? No problem! We believe in your potential and are committed to providing training and support to help you thrive. If you have transferrable skills, relevant lived experience or a willingness to learn, and you are interested in this role but you are worried about the application process, please get in touch with us. We encourage you to have an informal chat with the recruiting manager to discuss how your personal or professional experience and skills could be transferred to this role. Details of how you can do that are further down in this advert. Contract details
 
  • 22.5 (this represents 60% of a full-time role = 3 days a week) Hours per week:
  • Fixed Term for 6 months Contract type:
  • £24,294 per annum (£14,576.40 pro rata) Pay:
  • You will be based in central Bristol, close to Bristol’s main train and bus stations as well as the vibrant city centre. The location:
 
In return for your dedication, we offer: A few benefits at 1625ip
 
  • A generous annual leave entitlement of 30 days per annum plus all Bank Holidays
  • Employee Health Cash Plan with HSF
  • A supportive and approachable team with an emphasis on colleague wellbeing
  • “1625 Independent People is an amazing organisation and I feel very lucky to work here”, Colleague Wellbeing Survey 2024.
  • “I couldn’t be happier with the opportunities and support I have received in my career progression that has led me to my dream job!” See what other colleagues have said about their career development with us, on the . [vacancy page of our website](https://www.1625ip.co.uk/about-us/work-with-us/)
  • 1625ip is a Disability Confident Employer.
 
Important dates
 
  • Application deadline closes: or before if we have received sufficient applications. 23:59 on Thursday 22 January 2026
  • f you have not heard from us by the end of the day on , please assume that your application has been unsuccessful on this occasion. I Monday 02 February 2025

# [1625 Independent People](#)
 
## Project and Student Support Officer - Youth Education Service
 
We are striving to better represent the young people we support and therefore are particularly keen to increase applications from minoritized ethnic groups, Muslim, and male candidates as they are currently under-represented in our organisation. We also encourage applications from people with relevant lived experience. If you need an adjustment to be made to any part of the recruitment process, please let us know as soon as possible. We are a leading youth homelessness charity based in the Southwest, working with over 1,500 young people. At 1625ip we are driven by Social Justice and Passion: we strive to do something that matters and take pride in seeing the results of our work in social outcomes and improving young people’s lives. At 1625ip our work is rooted in Psychologically Informed Environments (PIE) and Trauma-Informed Practice (TIP). Our Psychologically Informed Framework shapes how we build relationships, use our spaces, and support young people. This means we prioritise safety, trust, collaboration, and understanding the impact of trauma in every interaction. You don’t need prior experience in PIE or TIP to apply - we’ll support you to learn and develop these approaches in the role. We are excited to be recruiting into our Youth Education Service (YES). The Project Support Officer is a key role for our small functional skills provision.
